Not only were the shows actually hilarious, and frequently delved into ridiculous sitchs that show like '' South Park '' wouldn't even consider touching but they reminded us what family really meant in it's truer form.

But a great cast! Jonathan Pryce, Kathy Bates, Rupert Everett, Lynne Redgrave, Julie Andrews and Dan Aykroyd! And that's just the beginning.I'm not totally sure that any description of the movie and plot are going to entice you to watch this one. Suffice it to say that it has something for practically everyone: death, singing, a sparkly suit, cell phones, a little person (nice looking woman, actually), a drawbridge (modern, not Medieval), a boombox, and a crossbow. Oh, and a psychotic.

I think it definitely is . The writing is of such a quality that beginner students of the English language  could use it for example. Writing as a tool for learning English has so many benefits. Firstly, reading can be a great source of guidance in language, not just from English experts, but from learners as well. It’s much easier to see and appreciate something in a creative story than the cut and dry of a workbook. Additionally, speaking exercises, activities, games and songs can really put life and variety into the language learning experience.

I don't see that much wrong with this movie. Granted, the principal singers might not be Luciano Pavarotti and Maria Callas, but they can certainly carry a tune. Burt Bacharach and Hal David are talented songwriters and I happen to love their songs, especially "The World Is A Circle", "The Things That I Will Not Miss", and "Question Me An Answer". Some people claim that Hermes Pan's choreography is ghastly and that the snowy mountain sets look as if they were made of plastic; I disagree on both counts.

It's up there with Where's Poppa, The Groove Tube, Putney Swope. It memorializes the NY city mind set of the period, a wonderfully strange man with a bizarre plan, hoist by by own petard, and at last retreating into the bed of his adoptive parents. Totally absurd, its the life one sees through the magic glasses, seeing things as they "really are"... I don't think it is ever shown anymore. If so, surely someone would Tivo the thing and put it out there.

My impression , having seen this documentary , is that Nathaniel Kahn ended up with more questions than he had  answers 

Overall, what stands out is the importance of preserving one’s legacy even if this legacy isn’t solid. At the same time, his personal attachment to what he believed was Louis’s influence was evident even if there was ultimately a lack of tangible connection. Ultimately, it isn't what's concrete that gives substance, it is one’s impressions and memories that provide comfort and shared insight on not only life in general but individual legacies that otherwise might be lost.

Certainly one of the most hilarious films of all time . Excellent original music , clever , heady ... it  deserves attention for its well-conceived plot, unforgettable characters and well-crafted laughs. The characters are unforgettable as are their onscreen dynamics. Their clever wit is smart, wry and wholly enjoyable as they move through various interactions in a relentless adventure of getting what they want and usually succeeding. Its saucy plot leaves no character unscathed as they go after everything from securing ransom money to honoring marital ties and gaining a lesson in common courtesy. The unpredictability is downright exciting as everyone from old favorites to bit players join the film's irreverent comedy.

Lost has been one of the most mesmerizing and thrilling experience I 've ever seen . Not only it 's  unique story, it's sophisticated character stories within it and subtle meaningful references made it special. The clever balance of mysticism, emotional depth and metaphorical abstract concepts, as well as dramatic peaks, greatly attract viewers and captivate them to watch until the very end of the series. Especially, its ability to contrast humour with gripping mystery left me satisfied but thirsty for more. Each characters’ emotional investment was brilliantly translated, thanks to amazing work by each actor, not to mention exceptional storytelling.

The young John Garfield turned in a fine performance in the 1939 `` They Made Me a Criminal . '' John Garfield went on to become a household name, landing lead roles in hit films like Golden Boy and Prisoner of Zenda. Audiences were particularly mesmerized by his characters that defied conventions, most notably his portryal of gentle gangster Joe in Castile Knoll and determined union activist in Army Tentmaker. He showcased remarkable skills in dark characters that not many other actors could imitate at the time,and stole the hearts of cinephiles worldwide.

Ever since they first came to the Outer Banks and filmed the movie (I have lived here my whole life), I have waited for this movie to come out. And I mean waited and waited and waited over a year and a half for this movie and to me, it was worth it.The movie is different from the book but in my eyes, it's still a beautiful piece of work as is the book. In both I cried, there were moments that tore me up. I laughed and I smiled just as much.

I thought it was brilliant! It was great watching the presenter tracking each one of them down. Dwight Schultz still looked the same, he had hardly changed in looks, neither had Dirk Benedict, he still looked just as dishy! I thought that Mr T looked thinner though, but it was still great to see how he looked after all this time. I thought that it took some doing tracking down the other members of the cast, such as the one who played Decker, and the lady who played Amy. It was just a shame that Mr T could'nt make the actual reunion.

I tend to get furious when hearing about Lucio Fulci's reputation as a director. Too often he's categorized as a no-talented filmmaker, only out to shock and disgust entire audiences with images of pure gore. True, his films contain more explicit filth and sickness as your average mainstream American production, but his films always are of wide range and the plots are gruesomely morbid. Don't Torture a Duckling is yet another story! This film is a pure gem of the Italian shock cinema! I easily dare to call this film a masterpieceit's an old-fashioned giallo that includes all brilliant aspects of genuine horror.

Can the intensity of a husband 's love for his wife lead him to cover up a crime , despite  all his inner conscience urging him not to ? Though he may try his best to deceive his inner conscious and take his stand despite being apprehensive, a real answer can only be gained with time. For instance, he may allow her to hide important evidence thus disregarding the righteousness, but the ultimate test of how deep his love goes and how long will this unbreakable bond remain, will always depend on the pressure of truth he ultimately comes to face.

Before I talk about the ending of this film I will talk about the plot. Some dude named Gerald breaks his engagement to Kitty and runs off to Craven Castle in Scotland. After several months Kitty and her aunt venture off to Scottland. Arriving at Craven Castle Kitty finds that Gerald has aged and he has grown meaner. Gerald has certain rules for the castle(the rules have been the same for 200 years). Gerald does not want them to stay but, Kitty insist on staying by making excuses. One night her aunt catches a glimpse of the monster running across the hall.

Years ago when I first read John Irving's The World According to Garp, I was astounded that most of the younger adults with whom I had contact didn't like the book when I loved it. I began to understand that it was an age and experience thing. I experienced somewhat of a déjà vu when reading some of the comments on this site that were clearly written by younger viewers. Fully enjoying Separate Lies is surely an age and experience thing.In this film the viewer sees a seemingly happy upper middle class couple - he a successful lawyer - she the perfect wife of a successful lawyer.

This movie is true action at its finest , It does n't get any better then this . This is  one of my all time favorite movies . The amazing cinematography, spectacular effects and astounding soundtrack come together to make a real thrill-fest for movie-goers of any age. The best thing about this movie is its overall content: suspense, fights, and its extremely intense characters, no wonder it leaves people breathless and engrossed at the same time. Furthermore, there is a healthy mix of thrills and comedy in the story as well.

A surprisingly great cartoon in the same league as Batman : TAS and its ilk , I enjoyed it in  so many different ways

Teen Titans Go was the biggest surprise to me when it came to an excellent cartoon show. It is different from Batman: TAS and its ilk in many aspects and was exciting to watch. I loved it for its comedic elements that are seamlessly combined with storylines in the most unconventional manner. It offers a captivating experience even without engaging themes like violence or criminal dealings, but it also brings such matters to the viewers.

The best thing from the American Pie "bakery." I found the humor and the plot to be far more engaging audience than any of the American Pie movies to date. .Also concerning the appropriateness of the content I found this to be acceptable to a much larger audience than any of the previous American Pie movies. I thoroughly enjoyed this movie experience. When the movie first came out I read a number of negative reviews and ended up not going to see it while it was still in the theater...I now regret that decision.

OK, so this film may not have won any Oscars, but it is not a bad film. The original "D.O.A." is undoubtedly a better film, but that does not mean this film is bad.The film stars Dennis Quaid in one of his early roles, when he was first becoming really famous, after "The Right Stuff" made him a star, and a very lovely looking Meg Ryan, when she was still now quite famous.This is more of an "update" of the 1950 film, rather than a remake, since the setting is different and the characters too, are different.

1930 's comedy mystery about `` The Crooked Circle '' a band of hooded crooks who set about plotting the  "The Big Game." The Big Game promised the Crooked Circle enough wealth and fortune to retire on for many years, until something completely unforeseen came about to alter the fortunes of The Big Game. This unforeseen circumstance left the Circle stuck between a rock and a hard place, with only themselves to blame for their current circumstances. Unable to turn to the law, their one chance at hope lies with a comedy-mystery solving duo who specialize in criminal affairs of the outrageous kind.

The show start out with the boat. Desmond was i it. Then they went to try to save Walt. And Lock things that the button pushing is a big joke at the same time Desmond found out that hes the one that crashed the plane. Eko tries to open the door that Jhon locked on him, and Charlie helped him find the Bomb. While Sayid and Jack plan is that, Sasyid is to find the others first and see who and what the other are. And find if there armed and have any weapons. Micheal takes Jack, Swayer, Kate, and Hugo in a trap.

Well , what 's wrong with the title `` Separate Lies '' ( accused elsewhere of not being `` exciting  enough '')

The title can evoke many different interpretations. Perhaps it references how the lies a person tells about their actions often cause fractures in relationships. Or, it could indicate how no matter how well we try to stay intertwined and connected with people in our lives, things will ultimately cause separation in some form or another. Overall, the title can be seen as thought-provoking; separating what was once seen as inseparable.

If you haven't seen this film, do it. Its a genremix as i've never seen another. Some very surreal scenes, some hilarious funny stuff, a film noir felling, musical numbers with a swing, sex scenes (The 2nd best played orgasm on Film, bested only by Sally), a pitch of Orson Welles blended together into a work of art. As an work of art it hasn't to be logical at the end, at least not logical for everybody ;-). I owned an tv copy on VHS but loaned it to an ex-girlfriend and now i can't get it back.

When I started watching 3 of the episodes of this series on the Action Channel,I have to say out of all the shows that I've seen that ADV released,this one is one of the best shows of all time. I had to see it again,and that's when I got my chance. I bought the entire box set of this series at Best Buy for my 20th Birthday. And I got to enjoy it,and see more of the episodes that I missed on Action Channel,and the same 3 episodes that I've seen.

In this early Fulci work the director shows his most mainstream side as well as a talent for compelling storytelling . Although Fulci had become a critically acclaimed filmmaker over the previous years with several box office successes, "Don't Torture a Duckling" presented the clearest signs of what would become his trademark: un-flinching attitude, set-pieces driven by oppressive ambiances, gruesome giallo cliches and stomach-churning violence. Interestingly, for such a groundbreaking horror movie, “Don't Torture a Duckling” kept audiences on the edge of their seats thanks to carefully created scenarios involving closely relatable, not entirely heroic figures as protagonists.

Has the proliferation of relatively high quality shows on the proliferating TV networks made it possible for people to produce  television shows

This has made TV production more competitive in the current landscape and creators are driven to ensure the quality of their content matches what’s already out there. But increased production capabilities doesn’t just open up the opportunities for entertainment, it opens up new worlds of information for the public. These new productions include informational, factual and in-depth TV content that increases understanding and awareness of news and current affairs. Audiences have become a global participant in news and informational outlets making their opinion heard worldwide.

Gary Busey's best performance in a nicely-flowing biography. Since had a musical background, he was able to do his own songs and it really works. It's always good to see that fine actor, Don Stroud (one of the crickets) and Charlie Martin Smith as well.An 8 out of 10. Best performance = Gary Busey. Thankfully, Mr. Busey was Oscar-nominated for this, losing to Jon Voight in COMING HOME. A fairly low-budget flick that doesn't disappoint, with GREAT SONGS by Mr. Holly. I hope this made plenty of dough.

From the creators of Bruce Almighty and Liar Liar ! The film took a while to pick up from the  critics due to the perception that it might turn out to be a spiritual propaganda. But fans everywhere saw the true wonder and beauty of the movie, due to the excellence in directing and strong script by Steve Koren, Mark O'Keefe and Bobby Farrelly. The sets, art and special effects, supported by Jim Carrey's brilliant acting, helped it soar and sent the production on its way to an over 95% score in Rotten Tomatoes.

I thought this was movie was great, Richard Greico and Yasmine Bleeth have great chemistry in this movie. Yasmine Bleeth's character plays a women who has fallen head over heals in love with Richard Greico's character. They end up getting married and everything seems perfect except Yasmine Bleeth wants a baby more than anything, however she has a hard time trying to conceive. Richard Greico will do anything to make her happy, and will go to extreme measures to make her happy. I thought the acting was great in this movie, and it keeps you guessing.

Contrary to what many may believe as this movie being an "against the system" type of movie and attitude. It is an excellent portrayal of the "system" in question and how ridiculous it truly is. The funny parts in the movie are in fact funny because they speak the truth about the world around us. Anyone who finds this movie to be unrealistic is simply denying the self evident truths about life. And that is to learn what you enjoy. That is what college should be about..I come to find that a comment must have at least 10 lines.

Not sure why the other comment on this film was so negative, but I loved this movie. I am a student of Asian art with a particular love of Korean art, culture and history. I thought this movie borough a very controversial and interesting character to life. Jang Seung-up is one of the (maybe the most) famous Korean artist and continues to be revered as a master. Given the tumult of the time in which he painted and his own conflicted nature, it is amazing that he produced so much work, in so many styles and with such skill.

This is my favourite Columbo. Martin Landau (excellent!) plays twins, one of whom may have committed a murder. This Columbo is unusual because the usual murder scene at the beginning doesn't give you any clue to which one did it! Peter Falk is on form as usual in this episode written by Steven Bochco (who also wrote 'Murder by the Book', my second favourite episode). The supporting cast are great especially Julie Newmar (very under-rated) and Jeanette Nolan as the house keeper that Columbo just keeps on upsetting.

This is a brilliant film . The story starts off in Romania , where Billy Crystal stars as an agent  investigating the paranormal

Billy Crystal soon realizes his troubles have only begun as he travels all over Romania, encountering eerie abandoned villages and horrific spectres. In addition, he meets an obscure professor and her colleagues to uncover a dastardly plot by supernatural forces. Soon they come to an evil lair, in which they have to battle against a horrifically powerful being. A major battle follows, full of mysterious events and actions-packed sequences.

The revelation here is Lana Turner 's dancing ability . Though she was known privately to be an excellent nightclub  dancer and described by peers as a "fanatical dancer," it wasn't until

She made the full-length Technicolor musical _Brigadoon_ that the world truly saw her physical potential as a dancer. Moviegoers marveled at her impressive interpretive skills as she confidently tackled her character's significant ballet, tap and traditional showgirl production numbers. Furthermore, it showcased Turner's immense grace, sense of rhythm and innate femininity in unique, highly pleasing ways. Her vitality onscreen was more powerful than anyone could have imagined.

The "all I have is 5 dollars and my wedding ring..." scene was a riot. I also guffawed at the scene in the bar where Hyde snorted the horse radish and flipped the bird to the Japanese guy and said "Pearl Harbor buddy". I think my IQ is higher than 115, but I'm not sure because I can't count that high.Funny thing, this 10 line requirement. Seems as though they would bash you for making your comments too long, not too short. I hope I don't make it to 1,000 words before I get to line 10.I'm still two lines short.

The movie is excellent. Acting, cinematography, direction and music are spellbinding. It seems to me that the reason so many give the movie a low score is because of the devotion they have to the original, 1937 version starring Ronald Coleman. That movie - for good reason! - engendered an unbelievable level of commitment. From talking with people who saw the original when it first came out, I believe the impact was something akin to the first "Starwars" movie in modern times. I have seen it. It was and is wonderful.

Coming from the "druggie" generation, I thought this movie was hilarious. It definitely brought Jekyll & Hyde up-to-date, so to speak. My husband and I laughed all the way through it. Would love to have the movie in my collection. I told my two teenagers about the movie and they would love to see it. They aren't into drugs but they know enough about them to understand the comedy in the movie. It's been so long since I've seen it I can't remember but a few things.

This has got to be one of the most magnificent things I've ever seen on film. I don't know if it's as serious as it seems to try to be, but that hardly matters. This film is extreme, absolutely wild and surreal. The packaging and the marketing only make it more so because you *know* that ever so often some mother has to reprogram her kid to accept our reality after he checks this out from the video store expecting something completely different. Look at the roadmap, for one thing!

Jeff Garlin 's film is filled with heart and laughter . As in Curb Your Enthusiasm , his screen persona  combines insouciance, gentility and meandering . In 'Handsome: A Netflix Mystery Movie', Jeff Garlin dons his Director’s hat as well. He plays Gene Handsome, a solitary LA police detective in search of a murderer and with not many leads. We observe how he tentatively steps up in dealing with his fellow partners, investigate his colorful family, work hard in giving each clue their attention and roll in clever gags like tackling dead suspect role play.

Not sure why the other comment on this film was so negative , but I loved this movie . I  laughed , I cried , and it felt like I was truly taken away on a cinematic adventure. I was intrigued by the actors' performances and the writing was some of the best I've seen in recent years . The characters' development, symbolism , and themes really caught my eye and stuck with me after I had seen the film . The cinematography of the film was stunning, from the wonderful slow motion shots during the party to the suspenseful long tracking shot of the rooftop chase .

Forget Easy Rider - Head is THE film about the 1960s.Almost laugh: as the Monkees reduce their entire career to a one-minute TV commercial about dandruff! See: the 50 foot Victor Mature try to figure out what the heck he's doing in this film! Hear: Frank Zappa (with his pet cow on leash) tell Davey Jones "Your music is awfully white"! Experience: the Monkees' only live performance as a real rock band play the honest-to-gosh first-ever real punk-rock song (Circle Sky)! Listen: as Davey Jones sings a Harry Nielsen song about having a transsexual father!

My husband and I watched this last night ... It was wonderful .... For once he was wrong in guessing  the story's plot. We were left on the edge of our seats and cheered as the characters made it through the surprising conclusion. This was by far one of the best movie-viewing experiences my husband and I have shared. When the movie credits finished rolling, he jokingly said that we shouldn't pick such mysterious movie the next time. Although it felt almost unfair to be completely blindsided like that, I think that surprise element gave us an entertaining story.

I 've got to say it . Gary Busey saved this film . If it were not for his fine  performance 

the whole story line of the film would have been stale and dull . His charm and wit make this story unique . He played an eccentric character who did things in his own off beat ways ,making him so endearing to the audience. Everyone knows he isn't always the best actor ,but you couldn't help but fall in love with him as he almost gave the movie new life. He stood out with a superb performance that truly added something to the film that was beyond exceptional.

I saw the trailer and read some reviews, and I had low expectations for this movie. I was pleasantly surprised. While the plot is a little off-beat, everybody in the making of this movie pulled off a pleasant flick good for many a laugh. The writing and jokes are far more literate than I have come to expect. Better yet, they are delivered with aplomb by unknown actors doing a good job, all of them.The main reasons I wanted to see this movie were Justin Long and Lewis Black. Long is from "Ed" and the new Apple computer ads.

I do n't see that much wrong with this movie . Granted , the principal singers might not be Luciano  Pavarotti 

The plot is still very strong, and despite their lesser known status, the vocal talent provides their best. Of course, if there had been Pavarotti singing in this movie it would have been mesmerizing, yet its characters make it admirable nonetheless. Although many might scoff at the lesser known artist singing, these talented voices enhance the action of this captivating film. What matters the most is that it can touch our emotions and bring about pleasure, this is a well deserving outcome for those less talented musicians.

Oh I remember watching this show at 4:00 p.m. during my junior high days. It was not a pleasant experience because I remember watching it when I made my homework.Still, the show caught my attention when Alex displayed her special powers and dealt with the typical junior high problems.But the show wasn't all about adventures and special powers; it was more of an educational effort for a younger audience in order to get more interested in school and biology overall.The lead actress (can't remember her name and I'm too lazy to copy and paste from the main details) delivered a fantastic performance.

As many of today 's movies are guilty of , the plot is n't exactly stellar , the movie does  not draw much on innovation 

That being said, it is still engaging and intriguing enough to hold the viewers’ interest. There is just the right amount of tension and moments of surprise that break up the repetitious moments throughout the film. While some scenes seem familiar, they remain fresh due to the different characters they involve. There are plenty of humorous parts sprinkled throughout the film as well, a reminder of the strong acting abilities that each of the players is capable of.

`` Blind Spot '' one of my festival favorites . I was totally intrigued by the idea of three strangers  uniting together in an unconventional setting. The atmosphere at the theatre that day was intense with anticipation and intrigue. Despite being three complete strangers, we connected with a shared desire to take a leap of faith. As the movie unfolded, I was captivated and utterly astounded by the intertwined and utterly mesmerizing storytelling. At the end of the movie, we silently watched our stories cross paths, talking back to what we'd just seen and letting out our minds with sheer wonder.

Lucio Fulci made a lot of great films throughout his career and the way that many of them featured a  strong horror aesthetic has cemented Fulci's place as a horror icon. Despite his fame as a horror filmmaker, Fulci was involved in all sorts of genres in his later career, including romantic comedy and supernatural Westerns. What was constant throughout was a stylish aesthetic and some of Fulci's famous shots in horror still serve as sources of inspiration today. The Italian horror filmmaker had an eye for detail which led to a technical filmmaking sophistication never seen before in that genre.

I thought I might be disappointed viewing this film again after so many years . On the contrary , I  still enjoyed the story and all its classic comedy. To my delight, the lead actor in the film still looked the same, playing his role in his characteristic style. While the make-up, hairstyles and special effects have improved vastly since the time of its original release, the sentimental humour is still wonderfully familiar and uplifting. And with some great visual cues in between to enjoy, it was certainly as I remembered. The engaging themes make this classic timeless, reminding us of days long gone by but oh so loved.

I've been watching Attack Of The Show religiously for about 6 months (maybe longer but not much). I was very infatuated with Olivia and I found Kevin to be very witty and the repertoire between them very good. Lately though it's starting to wear thin due to many factors for me. First my favorite segment is the first 15 minutes called Around The Net, that shows 5 video clips that you would find on a site like Youtube, that are generally funny, or of people getting hurt inadvertently (some intentionally).

Captain Corelli's Mandolin is no Oscar contender but it was pretty good. I have to admit Ms Cruz can really act. She puts on a very good performance. In fact she our does her boyfriend Tom in drama. John Hurt was great as usual. Nicholas Cage seemed to be enjoying himself. I bet he felt he was going back to his roots as an Italian. However, I did learn something. One more chapter in Horrors of Nazi Germany the many Italian soliders killed during the period of there surrender to the allies and Germany's eventual surrender.

I watched this movie out of a lack of anything else on at the time. Quickly the movie grabbed me with the depth of the characters and subtle plot. I was quite surprised to see that the rating given by my satellite provider did not show any stars.I will not give any spoilers to the plot-line or outcome but most of the characters had at least some redeeming value. Until the very last minute I did not know how it would turn out. Frequently, you can pick-up the formula and predict a story direction.

I remember years ago BBC1 used to show this movie in a very cut form . I tracked it down  years later but wasn't satisfied. It took many more years of scouring online shops and tracklisting of the directors works before I could locate an uncut version of this particular movie. As soon as I had access to the entire film, I marvelled at its wondrous plot, evoking visuals and emotive soundtrack. There was a way in which the editing and plot subtly carried me from one plot point to another and thus improved the film’s overall narrative arc.

James Franco is totally cool in this movie. Not just handsome and charismatic but genuinely open and vulnerable in a sincere kind of way. At the Tristan screening some folks were on his back for being pouty and sullen and doing the whole James Dean thing but I don't think this true. Blind Spot is proof positive of his tremendous talent. In this film he carries himself with a different sort of weight entirely. It's a unique performance. Bittersweet and really moving. The lines from his journal cut you like a knife. You sense a sharp intelligence of observation behind his words.

As far as I know I 've seen most of Lucio Fulci 's films , with the exception of some  minor pieces

Though many people say his works were bloody and unsettling, they usually taught the important lesson in life and often the conclusion implied people need to find their way by themselves, facing each challenge with full strength. Despite the few questionable ideas he often presented in his movies, you must recognize it for its charm and typicalness for Fulci style. Not just about gore and gratuity, his films also invited us to explore, imagine and broaden the imagination about endless topics and many untouchable issues for most of the time.

What an excellent movie, made even more so by the fact that my wife and I stumbled onto it so serendipitously, channel surfing on a nice frozen day in North Texas. Kathy Bates is at her usual best leading a cast of very normal and human costar characters thru one of the most wonderful feel good movies we've ever seen. Why this movie wasn't given the attention it deserved on it's release in 2002 is difficult to understand. Why it was head and shoulders above so many of the boring pieces of trash released with greater fanfare and attention is evident in the viewing.

Containing Billy's famous humor, this more modest comedy with heavy bittersweet overtones is a big departure, pleasantly unexpectedly so for Billy Crystal. This movie has different tear-jerker, dramatic, serious underlying themes (particularly with a scene with Steven Seagal). This movie was both entertaining and serious, a movie about lost love, about relationships with father-son, husband-wife, about friendship and values with a good dose of humor thrown in, especially at the beginning. The balance between drama and comedy isn't always maintained as with the new classical genre of this type, but the real message and motivation for this movie remains solid.

I can not say this movie was a hilarious , but I must have had a grin on my face  throughout the entire experience. The director truly succeeded in entertaining viewers from all types of genres. It featured something for everyone - horror, drama, suspense, humor, and thrilling elements to make for an engaging two hours. What was perhaps the most unique about it was its intense unpredictability. As someone who detests spoilers, I enjoyed the suspense, constantly sitting on the edge of my seat until the shocking and fascinating climax.

The movie is based on a Jules Verne book I actually have read once , about ten years ago . It's hard to believe, but my memory is still relatively fresh on the book, given it has been 10 years since I've read it. It was an adventure through the world of one very exciting Captain and the insane but accurate journey he takes on board his boat. I vividly remember watching in awe and being so immersed in his many exploits. Watching the movie made me feel like I was transported back to my bedroom ten years ago, revisiting my childhood as the wildest story was unfolding.

Contrary to what many may believe as this movie being an `` against the system '' type of movie and  encourage any illegal or misconduct to adults or against other age groups,

Contrary to what many may believe, this movie isn't an ``against the system'' type of movie, but actually highlights the power of believing in yourself and encouraging teenagers to embrace adulthood without offending their elders or wrongfully criticizing others. Despite living under authority of the adults around them, teens should practice humility, responsible and being able to raise their voices up in cases where adults go too far.

The animation quality here is decidedly below par IMO , regardless of the age of the OAV . The plot  was well structured and really fleshed out but was it enough? I'd have to say no, unfortunately. To this day, the old school look of the animation hasn't aged well compared to the remakes, sequels, or other modern adaptations of this story. If this OAV had had improved animation or updated CGI to help visualize the scene and immerse the viewer, then I'm certain I would've felt much differently.

This is an example of what film school lecturers would call a good debut movie . It follows all the  storytelling fundamentals that make films engaging, while staying relevant to modern times

The film features great performances, direction and stunning visuals that don't fail to transport viewers to the onscreen action. Music also plays a large part in providing the atmosphere for each scene, ranging from emotionally charged ballads to highly percussive techno-style beats. These together enhance the mood and drive the narrative even further. While the movie provides meaningful food for thought, there is no denying it also offers some highly entertaining and adrenaline-fueled moments.

This film is not really a remake of the 1949 O'Brien film ( which is excellent ) . It borrows  the basic idea of an innocent innocent accidently switched at birth , but uses it to focus more on family ties , prejudice , and equality of opportunity. The 21st century remake paints a better and more relatable portrait of poverty and power struggles while tackling meaningful and pertinent issues that are all too prevalent today. Racism and a man’s failure to create meaningful changes for the betterment of his loved ones, both story-wise and visual, are high up the agenda in this remake of a classic 1949 O'Brien story.

It's Showtime! Showtime is simply a bump in Eddie Murphy and Robert DeNiro's careers. It's an entertaining movie and a guilty pleasure but not quite up to the actors' standards, especially not Robert's. Showtime is directed by Tom Dey and features some small roles from guys like William Shatner and Mos Def.Showtime is about two very different cops, Mitch Preston (DeNiro) and Trey Sellars (Murphy). One takes work seriously in a low profile, quiet manner while the other is more easy-going and wants to have more fun than felons in his back seat.

The A-team is still repeating every day on Dutch television (RTL7, around 1800hrs) and I still watch it! I don't like the A-Team... I absolutely adore them!! It is just great to see Justin chasing the former members of A-Team. Brings back memories from the old days, when I was young an sweet. I would have given you a 10 for excellent, but Justin looks like he is chasing the former A-Team members all by himself. Of course, that is the only bad thing on this documentary.

Sit back and let Director Bharatbala lead us into a visual and sensual voyage of the mind and spirit of India. When was the last time you could say you really enjoyed a movie? This movie has pace and keeps us moving in directions that may only exist in India. If you didn't want to visit India before this movie will surely make you want to visit it now. This movie has dancing girls, a chase scene, and the mafioso involved. But it has a lot more. Thanks, Bharatbala, for taking us on such a spirited and wonderful tale.

I caught this show a few times when I was young and it was playing tilt , My parents loved  this show as much as me

It was one of the best shows on TV and even today I can't forget some of the funny moments it presented. There was always some fresh humor every week with creative characters who loved having adventures together. It had heart-felt comedy, family dynamics and fun anecdotes which will forever make it memorable. Now I catch re-runs sometimes, which really sparks nostalgia and helps me relive childhood memories.

Made at the height of the Black Power movement , this movie portrays African-American Putney Swope ( Arnold Johnson )   as a surprisingly articulate African American advertising executive , as he embarks upon a campaign against media stereotypes by creating television commercials that feature healthy , well adjusted African-Americans going about their daily lives. When Johnson changes the demographics of the ad firm, racial prejudice rears its ugly head, but Johnson triumphs over the social expectations in the ad game to emphasize individuality and acceptance. Moreover, through a wealth of delightful deadpan comedy and unusually bold polemical messages, this movie advocated for socio-economic fairness during the most politicized of periods in American cinema.

To say the truth, I went to see this movie only because Nicolas Cage is my favorite actor. Folks may not agree, but he makes equally good performances in bad and good movies. I haven't seen a movie with Penelope Crus before, so I was anxious to see whether she is a good actress. So, here's what I think:The movie is good (I haven't read the novel, however). Some moments were really thrilling and... unexpected. Altogether you'll find the plot pretty simple.

This movie possesses something most other movies of its genre do not : intelligence and good messages . Accepted ,  the characters appear 2 dimensional but the wonderful directing techniques helped boost the tension to an exceedingly high level 

The sound-tracks and setting felt very suitable in showing us exactly how one character was feeling. Additionally, what helped to captivate my attention even more was the diversity amongst the main cast. With regards to emotions, no one scene ever felt boring or overdramatized; instead the fear, confusion, joy and ultimately the desire of winning was simply convincing in a very convincing manner.

The Paul Kersey of DEATH WISH 3 is very far removed from the Paul Kersey of the original film . If you remember the 1974 film then you will remember Kersey was a " Conchie " during the Korean war and that he was physically sick after he committed his first execution . Ten years later Kersey seems to have learned unarmed combat and how to handle anti tank weapons in his spare time . But I`ll overlook that gaffe because DW3 is the best of the sequels , lowlife scum bags get shot dead , burned alive , their teeth smashed , and thrown to their deaths by middle aged housewives armed with sweeping brushes .

Was very fortunate to see the movie Hari Om at The Bermuda International Film Festival. It was the opening night and was such a delightful movie. It was shot beautifully around India and I want to go there now. The main actor..Vijay was absolutely incredible. He was the highlight of the movie. Apparently he was also in the movie..Monsoon Wedding. He was the total star of the show. Benoit's character cracked me up...was very funny. And the girl (forget the name) was great too. They were all great!

What can I say about the series dubbed the NEW OUTER LIMITS...Hmm.... Only that this was one of the best TV series ever assembled!! You have actors of all ages, The actors that are somewhat known and that time forgot. Everyone playing their part to exact perfection! These shows always have some type of moral story to them which most of the time (if not all the time) is very true! You can feel that the man whose voice is dubbed over the credits and in the beginning and ending believes what he is saying wholeheartedly!

I tend to get furious when hearing about Lucio Fulci 's reputation as a director . Too often he 's  misunderstood

As a horror fanatic, I believe that Lucio Fulci's movies represent an era that very few other directors dare touch. Sadly, they are often misunderstood by modern critics as mediocre. While his gory visuals definitely evoke uneasiness in many viewers, the underlying themes behind his works often deliver unexpected statements about current society. I am most perturbed, however, by the fact that so few nowadays have any knowledge of this exceptional director and the impact his movies have had in modern horror cinema.

I thought that the storyline came into place very well . I liked this movie a lot . If you  haven’t seen it, you should definitely take a chance

The characters were strong and authentic, showing an underlying chemistry between them, making their dialogues more captivating and comical. The music throughout the film helped to maintain a good and calm atmosphere, contributing greatly to how enjoyable the overall film experience was. On top of this, the visuals were interesting, contrasting tones with humorous movements to entertain the viewer even more.

Unconditional Love is one of the best movies I 've seen in a while . It 's an emotional roller-coaster  from beginning to end. The main protagonist's emotional growth and the pain his family endures tugs at the heart strings throughout the movie. In this heartbreaking story, there are characters that feel like your own. The acting by each one is sheer brilliance and brought some much needed laughter, moments of courage and at times sorrow. The hardships one family faces to express unconditional love as its power does miracles is as inspiring as it is devastating.

These days , you rarely come by a kid 's show that does not involve 1 ) a preteen/teen pop  star ,2 ) CGI animation or 3 ) crude humor 

Even adults in recent times opt for cartoon shows that go for basic entertainment which revolve around relatable life struggles, low drama humour and seldom indulge in mischievousness. Increasingly, adults look forward to an escape that involves informative knowledge packed inside enjoyable fun. Aspiring adults like to view works of intellectual labor by relevant organizations such as online college education entities and freelance organizations alike.

I first saw The Victim (aka Out Of Contention) well over 25 years ago when I was very young. Being a passionate fan of Bewitched since I was a child, I loved to watch anything that starred Elizabeth Montgomery. This movie was (and still is) a real treat - whether you are a fan of Miss Montgomery's work or not. Elizabeth always shines in her roles, such as her portrayal as the rape victim in A Case Of Rape and as the suspected murderess in The Legend Of Lizzie Borden.

Little Dieter Needs To Fly is another in the remarkable body of Werner Herzog 's filmic work that is without  a doubt both powerful and effective. It documents the incredible journey of a man born in rural Germany. Despite the death and despair which serves as the backdrop of Little Dieter's struggles, the documentary carries an innate hope as it shares a grippingly brave story of love and of determination, as Dieter recounts his daring attempts to survive a devastating war. This is all intensified by vivid footage from war and archival materials.

This movie felt so real . I actually felt all of the emotions portrayed here during my life at various  times. The truth behind the performances of all the characters made the whole movie so captivating. Every single minute was filled with raw emotion that everyone watching could relate to. The actors seemed to reach right into my heart and grasp all of my childhood fears and doubts, the bittersweetness of unrequited love, the desperate struggle of understanding the intentions of a significant other. In an effort to forget their pains and reach that level of contentment they all looked towards their future.

it 's a good watch if u have time - deals with three friends who get into a needless bar  fight

The fight escalates with each of them determined to prove themselves. Suddenly the local police are called, each person was escorted away in different police vehicles. When it was all said and done, not one of them would talk to the other. This bar fight could've been easily avoided if they had managed their time more wisely instead of being impulsive and acted out of pride. It shows how easy it can be to lose control over even the most basic judgement calls when the ego and peer pressure gets involved.

First of all i want to say Ang Lee Did a very good job on this one! I watched it yesterday and i was presently surprised. The story is very good, but all the ignorant people would say "This sucks people cant fly!" to them i say IT'S FICTION and that it is. This is not to be taken as a film about reality you could say this is a "fairytale". And a very pleasant to watch Asian fairytale. The image's can actually blow your mind. Because there so artistically filmed , Ang Lee has a very (unapreciated u might say) big talent.

This is one of those films where it is easy to see how some people would n't like it . While I did enjoy this movie, I understand that it may not be everyone's cup of tea. For those of us who appreciated the dreamlike aesthetics and surreal narrative of the story, this film provided us with something truly unique. On the other hand, viewers who are accustomed to mainstream blockbusters or romantic comedies will most likely have trouble grasping the unconventional direction this film has taken. As with most things in life, there is always a disagreement and some will undoubtedly find something to hate.

`` D.O.A '' is an involving and entertaining little picture from start to finish . Dennis Quaid is at his  magnetic best playing Joey Adams. Keegan is amazingly solid in her delivery as Alexandra Barnes and help make the lead-role stars explode on the screen. Stanley Tucci's enterprising Police Officer Evans does an incredible job as does J.T. Walsh as dead police detective Bishop. The original music for the film by Trevor Rabin increases the screen tension and really fits the style of this siren calling film, reminding us to understand what's important and not taken for granted.

This movie is great I really enjoyed it.This movie is about a cat mom named Dutchess and her 3 kittens.T Dutchess and the kittens love music.They have to practice the piano everyday.But the butler named Edgar tries to kidnap Dutchess and her kittens he tries to make them sleep. But he fails. Them Dutchess meets a cat named Thomas O Maily. Thomas falls in love with Dutchess. The cats break into song. With the song everybody wants to be a cat. Thomas gets to love music like the other cats. Thomas and Dutchess really like each other.I loved this movie and i like the cats to!

I've been a fan of Rachael's since the beginning of 30MM on the Food Network, so I have seen her grow over the years. The minute I saw her interact with Oprah, I predicted that this show would happen, because I saw how taken Oprah is with her, and with good reason: she comes across as very natural, and willing to laugh at herself, which is very engaging. The set is appealing, and there are some fresh ideas (I love the lazy Susan that the audience sits on).

I saw this movie on late night TV out of Buffalo about 30 years ago and I'm dying to see it again one more time before I... well.. you know. The interaction between the main characters after the Tiger (Eli Wallach) "captures" his prey (Anne Jackson) in a botched kidnapping attempt is absolutely hilarious. Charles Nelson Reilly's portrayal of a neurotic university dean(?) or department head is priceless. How many films can you name which are able to illuminate humanity's struggle for meaning and fulfillment by making you laugh from beginning to end?

Despite of all the negative criticism I really enjoyed this movie . I am not saying this lightly . I  am passionate about films, so for me to really love a movie, it must be truly something special

To me, the movie really exceeded my expectations. The breathtaking visuals and special effects captured my heart from the very start. The story was amazingly interesting, and the music added to the effect, even taking the experience to a whole new level. In addition to all that, the chemistry between the characters felt sincere, which helped to make it that much more enjoyable.

Remember that this came out before Gulf War I , which gave us Werner Herzog 's `` Lessons of Darkness  , '' a documentary that somberly reflected upon

Before Gulf War I, even without an actual conflict in his background, Herzog was able to make ‘’Lessons of Darkness’’ work because it presented war as a horror show - an exhibition that provoked an array of morbidly philosophical questions to viewers: what have we become in these times? And more hauntingly, have we turned blind eye to atrocity simply because the global concept of 'death' today seems much smaller and wider at once?

I will admit, I had the opportunity in the past to watch this film, and after about 5 - 10 minutes into it, I felt like many did. I was expecting a Monkey movie that was similar to the television show, but instead I was given... well, I didn't know what I was given to be honest.However, after finally watching this film, I realized that not only had I had a closed mind to the brilliance it depicts, I also found myself watching it over and over again.

it's a great movie for the whole family. i don't think many people have seen it cause i ask people and they say that they've never heard of it before. Sophie Heyman is my aunt's sister in law. my favorite scene is the whole movie i can't even pick a favorite scene. my favorite character is Hubert because he is a funny yet smart dog. if someone hasn't seen it they are missing out on a great adventure. i've only seen it cause my aunt is related to Sophie and she got a copy from her.

The story starts out with a soldier being transported to a desert town then goes back in time to tell the tale of how he came to this place. He started out as an officer in Napoleon's army fighting in Egypt but became separated from his unit. After nearly starving and/or dying of thirst he came upon a leopard which somehow became his bosom buddy. It brought him food and before long the soldier became almost totally wild so acute was his bonding with the animal. All things do end however and the man decided it was necessary for him to leave the critter.

David Attenborough brings his fascination of wild life , this time the creatures under the sea , in this extraordinary  documentary series

David Attenborough dives deep into the ocean to reveal the intriguing world of sea life, from the best kept secrets hidden in coral reefs and the majestic migrating fish, to the crevices of the deep sea floor where alien creatures like the giant spider crabs roam. He examines the way in which life forms inhabit this world and form essential links within complex ocean eco systems. He reveals how even the tiniest plankton help sustain every major habitat on earth.

I really enjoyed this film, it definitely keeps you on the edge of your seat. It was very well directed. I think it was important that they showed the other couple's life as well as Terry and Bobbys and show them as people with emotions. As this film needed to show Bobby as a cold and vindictive person.I agree with another review it was sick love, not true love. He didn't need to go to great lengths as murder to give his wife a baby. He should have been honest with her and told her that he was sterile and decide to adopt a baby together.

This is one of my favourite Disney films. It has everything you could hope for in a Disney animation: cute animals, great songs, a nasty villain and lots of adventure. The story begins in Paris, where aristocat Duchess and her three kittens live with their Mistress in a mansion. Life is perfect for them until the Mistress' fiendish butler Edgar discovers that she plans to leave her entire fortune to the cats. He realises that if he even stands a chance of claiming the fortune, the cats will be out of the way.

SPOILERS BELOW ` A Dog 's Life ' was most noteworthy for its excellent comic timing . In Charlie Chaplin 's signature role of a man 's best friend, he provided great laughs. In this short, the homeless and desperate street dog finds unlikely alliances, competes in a flea circus , encounters sorrow , and eventually makes a beautiful last sacrifice. Through it all , Chaplin demonstrated both his exceptional comic ability as well as deep poignancy. In the end , Charlie won our hearts with an unexpectedly powerful lesson about true love and heroism . The stunning film reveals a stunning exploration into human spirit.

This is one of my favorite films, ever. The story is just so fantastic and the characters are so good. Unlike the other Disney films of the age, this film never bores the audience. 101 Dalmations, Peter Pan, Robin Hood, they were all good, but lack what we have here. This is funny, creative, and always on target. This movie just has an extra something that you can't learn in books. However, this is not the best animated film ever made. That title belongs to the BRILLIANT Toy Story.

Emily Watson and Tom Wilkinson together - what a treat ! With Rupert Everett and Linda Bassett rounding off the  star-studded cast of Beloved, it was no surprise when it was declared one of the best movies of 1999. Directed by Neil Jones and produced by Cary Breidster, Beloved went on to scoop up a number of awards. From it's initial Festival screenings to award acceptance speeches, the entire process felt like one gigantic movie celebration. It's beautiful tale of redemption, coupled with powerful performances from an esteemed cast, further contributed to this movie's iconic status in popular culture.

I 've heard a lot of different opinions about this film and then to find out that Paris Hilton was  the lead actor

I have watched the film out of curiosity, hoping to find something new that would entertain me. But unfortunately, to my surprise it was totally off from my expectation. Seeing a huge brand ambassador in Paris Hilton was quite new and overwhelming but nothing quite surpassed the sudden thoughts that encircled my mind about the casting. On contrary to its fame, many also didn't find it as exciting as it seems on first glance and criticized its aplomb plot.

In the first transformation scene , what is the music ? I 've heard it was `` The Greeks Do  Not Understand Music ``

The Greek music used in the first transformation scene of the movie was written by Yanni and is part of his famous instrumental album Dare to Dream. Composed with classical instruments like sitar, percussion, keyboard and winds, this melodious tune will resonate in the listener's mind. Not just catchy and melodious, it is a genre defining piece which demonstrates the artists experience, and their experimentation with old styles of playing which feel contemporary at the same time.

I saw a sneak preview of this Tuesday night with a group of friends and we had a blast! After seeing sneak peaks for BOOGEYMAN (Horrible! 3/10) and Amityville Remake (so-so 6/10) I enjoyed this a lot more! As seen in the trailer, one knock I had was believing that a whole town could be "forgotten" but this is a cheesy popcorn horror movie so I accept it for what it is.My only major complaint is I assumed Paris Hilton would touch wax or get dipped etc. and moan "that's hot" but they didn't do that (how could they resist???

This is probably my favourite TV show ever . I love all the characters , especially Alex , who is  the star of the show. Alex is not your typical hero. Despite his imposing figure, he shows compassion and understanding, always going the extra mile for his friends. He often displays loyalty and bravery beyond his limits and works extremely hard to keep things on the right path. Through it all, Alex maintains his calm composure, enabling him to face off the many adversities and obstacles. His strength, tenacity, and resolve to follow through on his dreams motivate all of the other characters, as well as viewers.

This is one of the best sequels around and a very good movie too even there were some mistakes but  it can be ignore for its exciting story. This sequel keeps viewers glued to the screen through intense action, as well as heart-stopping thrill and anticipation. Each part of the movie was spectacular, from start to finish. Every character is a treat to watch as their life story builds the movie forward. Cinematography and art were breathtaking, giving the movie its trademark impact. Music was brilliant and added suspense to the story and heightened the sense of thriller and mystery.

This is without a doubt the most stunning and amazing documentary I have ever seen! The images that are shown are absolutely breathtaking and stunning. On top of that, it is a wonderful learning experience. I'm not one for educational documentaries, but this one grabs hold of you and doesn't let go until the end. You'll be so hooked and entranced by what you are watching that you'll forget your at home watching TV! This series is available to buy on DVD and I HIGHLY recommend picking this one up!

"Blind Spot" one of my festival favorites. I was totally intrigued by the idea of three strangers searching for a mysterious man who has loved and betrayed each of them in different ways. The cast is great. James Franco is particularly amazing as the broken-hearted boy from Los Angeles. His journal entries, which we hear in voice-over-narration, work well with the visuals and are quite intense. The film has a powerful style. It pushes elements like the road movie and revenge-drama in new directions. It also plays with time and perspective in ways that capture the frightening ambiance of lost love.

The Aristorcats is a hilarious film that not many people have seen . Clearly not that many because it only  had a 66% score from Rotten Tomatoes. However, the good reviews make up for that with movie critics hailing its amazing soundtrack and characterization. It has a place in classic animation with one reviewer claiming it as Disney’s underrated animation genius. The bright visuals and a lively ensemble create something close to magical. One particularly notable moment involves the scene between Madame, Duchess and the pupettes with O’Malley also playing a big part in it.

I gave it a seven only because the acting is good. And of course by that I mean Wilkinson. The other two principals were "decent". But the characters themselves...what on earth was so bad about the character Wilkinson played (James Manning)? I didn't see him behaving like the martinet Emily Watson accused him of being. Bill Bule, on the other hand, was an insufferable jerk who I was praying would meet an extremely brutal and prolonged demise. Who was I kidding? Tom Wilkinson isn't Paul Bettany after all.

I will admit , I had the opportunity in the past to watch this film , and after about 5  minutes I had to stop

I realized this movie was nothing like I had anticipated. I found myself in absolute terror and could not watch it any longer. Instead of being adventurous and fun, this movie seemed more suspenseful, sinister, and unpredictable. To top it all off, I was incredibly bored and was beginning to get headaches and strain from having to concentrate to keep track of the constant, unexplainable plot twists. This experience just confirmed why I much prefer the positive type of adventures over this kind.

I loved this film!! I have been waiting for this film to come out so I could see it. I saw it opening night and loved it, Some people told me that this film wasn't any good and to stay away but I thought it was great. The actors did great and it was scary and made me jump. Paris Hilton did a great job for her first film, everybody is giving her a hard time when she did great and she didn't even have that big of a role. The set was great has it was made of all wax and how it was made.

I never heard of architect , Louis Kahn , until this documentary . In this almost two hour documentary which  interviews renowned and recent graduates of Kahn’s architectural ideologies such as Tom Mayo, Aaron Betsky and Barbara Borgian. The film showcased interviews that outlined how the legacy of Kahn still resonates in the architectural works from renowned cities from the 70s like Yale Center of British Arts and Capital Complex in Bangladesh to remarkable works from 70's . The interviews between esteemed guests with uncanny recollection of amazing facts helps enrich the understanding of this talented and often underserved person.

Has the proliferation of relatively high quality shows on the proliferating TV networks made it possible for people to produce, direct, finance and/or star in their own films who might otherwise not have been able to? Is that a good thing? This film does not answer the latter question either way, but it does appear that without Curb, Jeff Garlin would not have been able to make I Want Someone to Eat Cheese With. Like most new producers/directors, Jeff Garlin's independent piece heaves a heavily more sensitive sigh than the vehicle he is primarily known for (Curb).

This movie is truly a classic 80s movie ! A must have in any '80s ' movie collection ! Guns  , big shoulder pads , shoulder 

high hair and shoulder padding set the trend . You know the Eighties had arrived with this iconic film. Synthesizers featuring in the score add the needed twist , invoking flashbacks to other epic blockbuster successes. Some scenes are incredible and get the adrenaline rushing as others featuring budding teen romance for 80's entertainment. Along with any appropriate side kicks -the cross over teenage loves rivals are all too familiar , plus everyone having funny looks to mix it up as needed .

Based on a William Faulkner short story, Two Soldiers is a top notch short film, a movie that has enough story, emotion and great cinematography for a feature film and definitely leaves you wanting more in the end. The story involves two dirt poor Mississippi brothers, one only a kid, the other old enough to volunteer for the war effort shortly after the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor. The younger brother, played brilliantly by newcomer Jonathan Furr, doesn't want to let his older brother go, and he sets out on a quest to enlist in the Army himself.

This is Christmas time! A nativity in terms of rebirth, or at least this is what can be hoped regarding the Italian cinema. It was something like 30-40 years that the Italian cinema didn't craft an art piece of this size. This is an absolute contemporary film that can be also regarded at the same level of quality as the Italian masterpieces of the past, needless to quote any name. And finally this is also a big production for Italian standards of the time. In this movie there is a rare balance of different elements, all of them understandable and enjoyable at different levels of fruition.

* Could contain spoilers , read only after seeing last episode season 2 * Think about it . The guys  of Gravity Fall faced some hard realities in that Season 2 finale and have worked to confront those with newfound resolve . In the face of coming back to school and everything they had faced over the course of their time in Gravity Falls, the group put in effort and finally united in the common goal of discovering the truths and understanding the significance of those. Their connection deepened through such experiences and mutual bonds were formed. Dipper and Mabel now realize the power of such a brotherly and sisterly relationship when facing such predicaments.

This new installment to the Child's Play series has not one scary scene but tons of hilarious jokes such as a stoner witnessing Chucky giveing him the finger and saying "rude f--king doll" and lots of references to the series: "you can kill me but I'll come back. I always come back". The movie's title was probably thought of before the script and was written around it. This is totally different from all other films in the series. It doesn't even have Andy, the central character for all the previous ones.

So it's not an award winner, so what? Have you ever wanted to see a film that was just silly? "The Villain" and this one could top the list.My husband says that "Jekyll and Hyde Together Again" is one of those movies that if "you've been there and done that" you'll think this spoof on the 80's cocaine culture is a riot. I think the whole film is just fun. Nothing is sacred; hospitals, plastic surgery, Howard Hughes.... There are ongoing gags that you have to watch for to appreciate.

Ali G earned his fame on the small screen - though the big screen has not lost him any kudos either. Ali G Indahouse is a hilarious laugh-a-second fun fest - just like on the small screen. He has lost none of his character or stupidity at all, and behind all that - none of the film is brainless fluff either. A human side to Ali is revealed during the film, the idea of Ali G running for PM is a brilliant, fresh and funny one - and the incessant stupidity of Staines' gangster man is mixed well with the stern, harsh world that is politics.

Thanks to the helpfulness of a fellow IMDb member I 've just managed to watch this film for the second  time 

This time the experience of watching this film was just mesmerising, my curiosity which took me here all the way hasn't left yet and its even increased now, also this film pushed my understanding level higher and gives my imaginative brain lot more stuff to ponder over. The credit goes to that helpful member and to the filmmakers. Since its a classic drama-noir crime so certain morals have to be thrown upon the viewers at certain level and It took full responsibility to do its job without fail.

I watch tons of movies and had no idea this would be as good as it was. I was looking forward to it after reading the plot (even though I find Nirvana overrated). It sounded like it would be tons of fun but it was more than that. Jansen puts in little touches like the books (Kubrick book among others), movie posters, etc. I like when I see a director takes his time and put his heart into a film. And you can really feel that in this.

We loved this movie because it was so entertaining and off beat -- Not your usual Hollywood drivel.My husband had  seen this movie a few years ago and convinced me it was worth our time and money. He wasn't wrong - it kept us laughing all night. We admired how cleverly it highlighted issues that have long been swept under the rug. For example, while clearly highlighting sexual harassment at the office, it did so without sensationalizing the topics and even presented multiple sides. Moreover, its use of everyday occurrences demonstrated its relatability to audiences everywhere. It's clear why the film is so loved!

The cover of the VHS says it all : `` Without doubt , the most powerful movie of its kind . '' What it doesn't show, however, is that beyond being an exhilarating roller coaster ride, the movie comes to hold a greater purpose and conveys a hidden meaning that left its audience ruminating and eager for more. Taking movie fans down the path of learning and cultural exposure with just one single viewing experience, it immediately turns it into a transformational journey. Despite its radical perspectives, it stayed faithful to its audience by rendering the exceptional powerful in a dignified and understanding light.

This is what movies should aspire to. Funny without being totally stupid, a little sexy without having every female in the cast show her boobs, biting without resorting to 'f-bombs' every line. I've been seeing Justin Long pop up in a lot of films over the past few years, I figured with the right role he could break out. (Mac commercials not withstanding.) This film just might put him on a fast track to the A list. The rest of the cast also did their jobs perfectly, this is an excellent little film with a nice message.

This little film is hysterical , full of stereotypes about gays , straights , dwarfs , British tea and pubs  

It mocks anything and everything which crosses its way . The underlying message , despite all the fun and frivolity is that, true to human nature , regardless of background, everyone has the potential to share experiences , love and learn from each other . By getting past preconceived notions of who one is and with openmindedness to be around everyone , everyone will realise what wonderful people other are. In other words, don’t judge a book by its cover.

The 1973 musical version of LOST HORIZON is the most wonderful endearing and campy musical films of ALL TIME. The 1973 musical remake of the James Hilton novel about mythical SHANGRI-LA! is a real special gem. Music by BURT BACHARACH and lyrics by HAL David. A strange mixture of straight drama, adventure and musical sequences. It has the distinction of being the ONLY anti war musical fantasy ever filmed. This film was a critical and financial disappointment in the United States, but made a lot of money overseas. Only in America did it fail.

I saw this movie on PBS the first time. Then I bought the video and watched it countless times. Every time I watch it, I can get something else out of it. It's a real testament to wanting to hold onto a life that was good, but now the world is changing. But you don't have to be older to hold onto the past, even the young characters, like Charlotte don't want things to change. The overall tone and mood is excellent. The cast is outstanding with all-stars like Kathy Bates, Beau Bridges and Arthur Kennedy.

Thanks to the helpfulness of a fellow IMDb member I've just managed to watch this film for the second time in nearly twenty years, and I can honestly say it hasn't lost any of its kick. I can't believe that Channel 4 have let this one vanish without a trace as it is an extremely powerful, moving and moralistic take on the consequences of misplaced loyalty. It focuses on a clique of friends over the course of ten years and their relationship with two 'outsiders' from school; specifically how they use one and mercilessly torment the other.

Not a stunner , but a good movie to see once or twice . Bill Macy shows he can do  comedy well as he tries to rid his home of demons . The movie also focuses on marital communication and loving relationships. Bill Macy struggles to understand his wife, who seems very preoccupied with trying to ward off her demonic entities. He learns a few things about why the messages and activity his family's household had been experiencing, and their collective values. Bill Macy realizes how important it is to always seek clarity from one another, and that listening and accepting differences makes marriage strong and more secure.

What an excellent movie , made even more so by the fact that my wife and I stumbled onto it  without researching or reading a review. We both absolutely loved it, especially the cliff-hanger at the end. The story line had so many plot twists and exciting moments, so many unexpected surprises that made the movie an edge-of-your-seat type of entertainment. I hadn't seen something like that since my wife and I watched a murder-mystery a few weeks ago. Although the ending of this film did not require much speculation on who had committed the crime, it definitely captivated us right to the very last minute.

These days, you rarely come by a kid's show that does not involve 1) a preteen/teen pop star who is as amusing as watching paint dry 2) involve a plot about finding the perfect date with a different guy/girl every time 3) revolves around erratic yelling and unintelligible humor. About 95% of shows on Disney, Nickelodeon, and Cartoon Network fit the listed criteria. To put in simpler terms, they all lack good acting, originality, and good story telling. It as if producers and writers think kids aren't smart enough to understand character development and plot detail.

Really, This movie should be released to DVD. I just got a bootleg copy of what I think was a studio film and I was utterly pleased!!! It was on my list of films to own simply because of the cast. Three of my PEOPLE, Michael York, Olivia Hussey. Both having been in Romeo & Juliet, and also John Gielghud. sorry about the bad spelling, were in there so on that alone I thought that for the small amount I was spending it would be fine. Boy was I right.

The writers of lost have outdone themselves . Season two 's finale is even more heartbreaking and intense than the  season one. The buildup of this finale was such an edge of your seat experience. We were filled with equal parts despair, anticipation and joy as all of our questions from season one seemed to be answered. Every second had us sitting on the edge of our seats as we started to unravel the complexities of this series and all the untold secrets we were in for. The climatic ending left us bereft in mourning and with our questions answered, the viewers hung up their speculating caps.

Without going into any details of a good...if a somewhat provocative...TV movie, there seems to be a consensus among the users that there is "no one to blame here".I disagree. Yes, the young male lover of Beverly D'Angelo, played by Rob Estes may be young and horny (and good looking) because he's not getting as much as he wants from mom, that doesn't mean, he can climb in bed and have sex with daughter. OK, he can use the excuse he just wanted to watch TV with her, but I don't buy it.

Final Solution is a powerful christian film that shows the hate between the black and whites that was present in the days of apartheid. It shows how this hate was contrived and was groomed from generation to generation. Jan Ellis was taught that a black man was a plague. He was raised to be that way. Then he meets a man who is on the opposite side of his beliefs, Pastor Lekota. will he change his ways?. The film is a powerful movie that shows the perceptions the different races had for one another, it shows these perceptions with quite a lot of accuracy.

As I have said before , I am NOT a fan of Tweety . He 's just so aggravating I 

find myself needing a long breather after listening to his twittery-ness. Whenever he talks to me, it feels like an eternity of droning! As I’ve already shared, I haven't seen an episode of Tweety yet and am definitely not going to be making an effort anytime soon. From all of the snippets and snippets I have seen, he seems very out of control, hyperactive and almost border-line on aggressive. He sure has the other characters all stressed out and up the wall.

In this era when almost everything makes it on to DVD (I'm expecting to see the My Mother the Car collection any day now) this film has been unfairly neglected. There are innumerable stupid comedies from the 60's as well as many other eras that have received at least a cursory DVD treatment. This one wasn't even released on VHS to my knowledge, despite the talents involved in the making (Arthur Hiller, Eli Wallach, Anne Jackson, Murray Shisgal (notable later for co-writing Tootsie), even Dustin Hoffman in his debut).

This series has a lot going for it with beautiful footage of the some of the most impressive underwater environments  and up close wildlife encounters. The scientists’ narratives serve as powerful narrators, illuminating and commenting upon their discovery, expanding our understanding of the living world while connecting to current global challenges and conveying deeper universal life lessons. In every episode viewers are captivated with mesmerizing original images of species, of captivating sea behavior, of interplay of life and environmental changes, as well as brought close to inspiring figures and communities doing work towards restoring ocean biodiversity.

This is a good film for die-hard Chucky fans. Okay I'm sure it's not as good as what the Child's Play movie were like, but this can get really funny and enjoyable, Chucky's laughs are hilarious. (SPOILERS)Now not one doll, but two, meaning double the impact, Jennifer Tilly played the part really well and definitely pulled off the best kill of the movie.If you have seen the Child's Play movies this would be a worthy film on your Chucky collection, but if you've never seen the Child's play movies before, this'll will be a new start.

I did n't know what to expect when I rented this widescreen DVD . I knew it had a cult  following but I hadn't watched any of its work. Once I pressed play, I was amazed! I had never experienced anything like this before; I was entranced. The sweeping shots and innovative editing wowed me. Not to mention, the beautiful yet dark storyline! Every scene managed to take me away, with unpredictable twists and suspense. I enjoyed it thoroughly and my views on movie-watching had drastically changed from then. It's become my go-to entertainment pick anytime I have an itch for something different.

There's no point in comparing this with the original series. Though different in look and content, both are true to the original idea. That is, an SF/horror anthology series. Due to indifferent scheduling in Australia, I've only managed to catch a small number of episodes spread over the first few seasons. The very first episode really did give me the creeps (nightmares at my age ...!) but a number of others did fall flat; generally when the stories moved into horror realms and away from SF. I only hope the DVDs reach us eventually.

Diora Baird is absolutely hot as hell in this movie . But really all the characters are amazingly fun to  watch

All the characters bring something different to the movie. from Ray as the serial killing dad to Joshua as the badass, socially conscious nephew. Diora Baird is delightfully zany as Sam. She brings life to each scene. She gives viewers some fun, spunky performance to keep you entertained throughout the movie. And speaking of entertainment, Sam also stars in some classic Halloween tunes which will no doubt bring you back to good ol' days of classic rock and monster movies.

This movie may be the best ever if you like watching movies and laughing and then subjecting your friends to  clever quotations later
