The writing was fast-paced and humorous with surprising twists that have stayed with the audience even after seeing it multiple times. This movie captures some special place in people's hearts, especially the loyal fanbase that make regular outings to see it and stand by its importance within the context of film history. The brilliant comic timing, outstanding direction, and many references to works of literature, as well as familiar characters from filmography, keeps one entertained to the last frame.

I 'm not sure why this film is averaging so low on IMDb when it 's absolutely everything you could  possibly want in a movie. This movie keeps you guessing the entire time and always with great tension that mounts throughout the entire film.The characters are fully developed, with great storytelling elements and direction. There are unexpected plot twists, especially with how it all comes together in the end. You will laugh, cry, and hold your breath! The emotional roller coaster throughout the entire film is definitely something special, that leaves the viewer emotionally engaged throughout.

What a great film! I never knew much about Buddy Holly, but was familiar with his lively and fun music. This is a wonderful biography of someone who helped change the music in the 1950's. Although I never cared for Gary Bussey, he was fabulous as Buddy Holly! I don't know how accurate the movie is, but assume at least for the most part it is accurate, which makes the movie all the more interesting. The music throughout the movie just adds the pizazz to this biography. I don't think I would change a thing in this film, it was all good!

`` Back in the Day '' is an interesting , but flawed effort . Ja Rule stars as Reggie Cooper  , a streetwise former-criminal , and Heather Locklear is great as Denise Sullivan , Reggie’s first and last true love. However, the flaws appear right in the first scene as Reggie not only continually changes clothes but even though its summer time, his clothes keep changing in their seasonal garments which breaks up any kind of film continuity. The rest of the plot may appear too coincidental for some viewers but at the same time there are surprising plot revelations.

Chucky is back but this time he is not scary (a lot) - but he is funny!When Chucky is brought back to life (in the doll, of course) by his old trailer trash girlfriend, Tiffany, he promptly kills her and transforms her into a doll, too. Tiffany and Chucky are now on the case of 2 high school graduates - eekkk! !Don't miss this film - it is a whole lot of fun. It is scary, funny, weird, wacky and stupid all in one!My rating : 9/10.

My husband and I watched this last night...It was wonderful....For once he was wrong in guessing ahead of time the suspenseful ending. It moved along very quickly and the acting was superb.. I adore Tom Wilkinson anyway. He has never made a bad movie as far as I'm concerned. The above description of his acting hits the nail on the head... The facial expressions are incredible. Even the picturesque scenery is awesome. We have just finished watched all of the Prime Suspect series and I am convinced that the British have a way of capturing the audience.

I saw a sneak preview of this Tuesday night with a group of friends and we had a blast ! Everyone was laughing hysterically and the atmosphere was lively. We cheered whenever there were thrilling scenes, we talked about which characters we identified with, and as soon as the movie finished, we were already talking about how excited we were for its wide release. My friends and I exchanged theories about the plot, speculating on how it was going to unfold in the sequels. As we exited the cinema we couldn’t help but be excited for the opportunity to watch the movie again.

When `` Madame '' decides to let her cats inherit her it spells trouble . The snobbish Butler Edgar who  manages her home along with her enormous estate for years knows he should take control of her 

He speaks to Madame's closest relatives and the staff at her estate hoping to convince them of what is best. Madame remains firm, however, believing her decision was the right one. He begrudgingly submits to Madame's request but a feeling of dread fills him with unease. What if the cats act upon their baser instincts, put them and their trust at risk?

Oh my gosh!! I love this movie sooooooooooooooooooooo much!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! It is so incredible......I loved it as a wee babe and still love it as an adult. It is my favorite Disney movie of allllllllllllllllllllllllllllll time! You should watch it, watch it and love it. My friends and I watch it a ton.....It is soooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo good. I recommend it to anyone who is a child or a child at heart.

I think that this short TV series , was absolutely wonderful , and gave both a in-depth and clear explanation  of what it truly means to practice forgiveness

It gave an authentic illustration of how people could heal from deep and heart wrenching pain by showing simple but tangible steps towards compassion and reconciliation. Seeing characters on the brink of closure but find peace as well as offering solutions for tackling pent up anger, hurt and pain provided meaningful catharsis. I strongly suggest watching this series to all who’ve ever found it difficult to extend forgiveness and expect similar miracles to help make healing process smoother.

I was watching an NFL game and started surfing during a break and found this on one of the HBO type channels. I missed the beginning but when I started watching Deadly Voyage the clicker was put down and not even thought of until the credits rolled. You will find yourself rooting against the villans and on the edge of your La-Z-Boy throughout this one. If you get the chance take the time to watch it. Every once in a while I think about having the cable company take off my Movie channels but when you stumble across great ones like this you know why it is worth paying extra for them.

I saw Borderline several years ago on AMC. I've been looking for it ever since. It was haunting: visual, textural, sensual. This movie took me somewhere like a dream and I didn't care where. I will never forget the curtain blowing in the breeze. I still remember the way it made me tilt my head. I remember my facial expression when I saw it. I didn't know what had happened when the movie was over, but I find life is that way. It didn't bother me.

'Captain Corelli's Mandolin' is a fantastic film in itself. It is nothing like the book, which may disapoint its ardent followers. Yet, viewed on it's own, the film is a masterpiece. The views are spectacular and the acting isn't too bad either!! Nicolas Cage was brilliant-so different from his usual action hero type characters. Penelope cruz is superb and really holds the film together. I think that this film has to be judged as an indivdual project-not related to the book. Louis de Bernieres gave up rights to the film script, so the film is an interpretation of the director, john maddon.

Death Wish 3 is exactly what a bad movie should be . Terrible acting ! Implausible scenerios ! Ridiculous death  scenes ! Lackluster story-telling, occasional monotone line deliveries, horrid fashion decisions, eye-rolling one-liners, blatantly unrealistic locations and dimly-lit cinematography...Death Wish 3 delivers all these no matter which way you look at it. On top of this it also touts cringe-worthy fight scenes, overflowing over-acting and more sudden impossibilities than can be seen in any 10 average slasher flicks combined. It's hilarious, ungraceful, exciting and perfectly awful all at once! A sure fire classic for lovers of intentionally-bad film!

I first saw "Signs of Life" on PBS as an American Playhouse presentation. It's a wonderfully written, ensemble production with terrific performances by Michael Lewis as Joey and Vincent D'Onofrio as his brother, Daryl. Arthur Kennedy, in one of his last roles, is also excellent as an aging shipbuilder whose family business is about to close. The rest of the cast which includes Beau Bridges, Kathy Bates and Mary-Louise Parker give remarkable clarity and substance to their characters.The direction is subtle and effective. I've watched this movie several times over the years and would very much recommend it.

Just as in "Columbo" we see the fatality occur right at the beginning. What follows is an escalating web of lies, sex, blackmail, and murder. The investigating officer, Adam Arkin, is even somewhat of a fumbler, not unlike "Columbo". It is William H. Macy, as the movie critic suspect who carries the film. Constantly twisting and turning, the plot sends Macy deeper and deeper into the quicksand of his "perfect crime". William H. Macy fans will enjoy "A Slight Case Of Murder", as will those who like crime capers with all kinds of delicious possibilities.

What a surprise . A basic copycat of the comedy classic 'The Nutty Professor ' only naughtier . Funny guy  Joey Nihilist becomes 

Professor Nihilist. An entertaining hybrid of past favorites, set to rival any college fave. With a wild and enthusiastic twist on an old favorite, Professor Nihilist has both parents and young kids rolling with laughter. Full of great life lessons and at the same time witty and modern dialog, the audience of all ages will appreciate the strong messages conveyed. Creative genius casts and masterful script adds amazing accuracy in caricature. Despite its pratfalls Professor Nihilist could also go on to inspire one-liner magicians of tomorrow.

The 1973 musical version of LOST HORIZON is the most wonderful endearing and campy musical films of ALL TIME . With a all star cast that includes Peter Finch, Sally Field, and Liv Ullman as the core trio with additional scene stealers by Olivia Hussey, George Kennedy and Michael York, this musical adaptation takes us on a visual and musically delightful journey with positive moral message that stands to the test of time. Even when the wacky outfits of yesteryear reminds of the temporal limitations, it never hurts the spirit and upbeat tempo of the feature.

This is NOT the masterpiece that is Snow White, Cinderella, or Bambi, but it IS a very sweet, enjoyable, romantic, well-done Disney animated feature.There are, of course, lessons included herein for the kiddies, and some very appropriate kiddie-cheek, but there is plenty herein for the adults, as well.While this is somewhat of a regurgitation of the Classic Disney RomCom Adventure, it still holds some elements, which solely belong to the AristoCats. O'Malley is the "tramp" and Dutchess is the "lady," but Dutchess has several kittens and they are all trying to get home.Phil Harris is our tomcat O'Malley.

`` Do n't Torture a Duckling '' is one of the coolest Italian horror films I 've ever seen , 

It's a unique thriller that successfully merges horror and suspense with subtle wit and horror humour. What makes the film such an iconic piece of horror art is its sophisticated storyline, dynamic characters, unique soundtrack, and artful visuals. Set in Southern Italy during a backdrop of superstition and taboo, this crime story about a brutal serial murderer doesn't flinch in terms of dealing with dark topics such as justice and revenge, albeit with great empathy towards those whose livelihoods have been destroyed.

That this film flopped at the box office, and still struggles for the recognition it deserves today, is a great pity - yet somehow rather appropriate. The commercial suicide the Monkees committed by making this film is mirrored by the metaphorical suicide they commit on-screen. To destroy so brutally their carefully constructed image as a wholesome American alternative to the Beatles is courageous to the point of rashness, as is the admission of being no more than pawns in the entertainment industry, trapped (in the movie, literally) in their own artificiality.

i love this film ! ! maybe it is my generation but i can really connect with what he is  saying 

I also found it funny how he brought together all kinds of people, backgrounds, and opinions, despite their differences. Every single one of the characters felt like a real human being and the conversations were very thought-provoking. Watching the film made me understand my generation and the struggles they are facing better than before. All in all, the movie felt timeless to me and the messages he put across felt universal regardless of age, nationality or background.

I loved this film , which I have just seen at the Philadelphia film festival . In March 2005 I  had seen a TV version

In March 2005 I had seen a TV version of this film, but I found the screen-width way of viewing makes it look much better. This thoughtfully made drama tells a sad story of loss and solitude. A remarkable actor turns in an extremely accurate portrayal of a common yet fragile emotion - despair. The gradual spiral downward of a couple broken apart by tragedies captured this audience. Some were so profoundly moved, tears were visible throughout.

I believe that this is one of Elizabeth Montgomery 's best performances in a movie , and I have seen  quite a few of her movies

This movie will remain a favorite for me forever. Elizabeth Montgomery gives a powerful performance in the lead role as Katee Phillips , who tries desperately to break free from her alcohol addiction. Her painful and honest portrayal truly depicts her hardships and emotions. In her drunken state, Montgomery portrays Katee Phillips as a madman's wild swagger and malleability with fervor. All throughout the film she comes in with big unpredictable moments and tiny to display different emotion and commitment towards her roles.

My Architect is a great film about Nathaniel Kahn's search for himself via the legacy of his famous Architect father, Louis Kahn, dead since 1974. The film builds slowly, but perfectly, and what starts out as a seemingly lost fortysomething's identity crisis unfolds into a beautiful tale with much deeper meaning with regard to the importance of love, loss, family and perhaps more importantly, our life's work.I had never heard of Louis Kahn prior to this film, although I was vaguely familiar with some of his work.

* May Contain Spoilers * The first time I saw this movie was when it was re-released on video when  I was 13. At first, I couldn't take it seriously - it was like the kind of adventure films I loved, but with the focus on adults, not just kids. I hadn't heard the buzz about it that everyone was talking about. So, I figured I should give it a shot, and boy, was I glad I did! The story moved so quickly and the characters were all so lovable.

I've been looking forward to seeing this film ever since I first caught the trailer, and I'm so glad now that I have. It's truly a wonderful film. The actors are superb, the writing is fresh and real, the whole thing was just spot-on. I love James McAvoy in this, and I can't wait to see him in "The Lion, the Witch, and the Wardrobe" movie this December. Romola Garai is wonderful too. Be sure to check her out in "I Capture the Castle" or "Nicholas Nickleby," two of my favorite films.

Hey all you jive hustlers, you stone foxes, you mean dudes. Watch out cause Slaughter is back in town! If you are looking for a bad-ass, funky film to watch some night, this is just right. 'Slaughter' is back and trying to take it easy n' relax after his adventures down in Mexico. But if you are a narrow-minded gangster like 'Duncan', you are bound to seek revenge. Why, I don't know. Was 'Hoffo' in the first one his brother or what? Any who.

Captain Corelli 's Mandolin is one of Nicolas Cage 's better films . He turns a fine performance as the  military officer trying to keep peace while managing to experience love and life while being in a seemingly never ending war. His interaction with the local folk of Greece shows off the charm of a love story set against the brutal landscape of WW2. In a balanced and subtle performance Cage leads us through this extraordinary story about one mans fortitude in the face of ultimate struggle. Many a bittersweet moment is granted the screen under the warmth of Cages allure.

Anyone who has seen Ali G before, should be well prepared for the full motion picture that is 'Ali G Indahouse' Although I prefer Ali G when he is interviewing the rich and famous, his brand of completely off the wall comedy definitely entertains from start to finish on the big screen too.Ridiculous plot, ridiculous characters and a ridiculous script, that all make this film a riot for fans of Ali G.If you've seen him and didn't like him then avoid this film like the plague, because it's definitely just more of the same; for everybody else - watch it Aiiii!

For all those people who believe the dialog is worth something , and who appreciate a farce that is clever ly devised

The drama and farce provide ample distraction to brighten up even the most hard pressed days and elicit honest and thought provoking discourse. They teach us, enlighten us and entertain us in ways that textbooks never could. And even in those moments where something that was supposed to elicit laughter comes off wrong and misguided, a humorous look and the will to be more deliberate with future comedic ventures can win out over errors of intent.

I ca n't get this flick off my brain . It 's definitely totally different than anything that 's out  now

It keeps lingering, poking, prodding at me from within my inner most depths. No amount of distraction can get my mind away from it. What exactly about it lingers in my conscience, its nearly hard to describe. It's something exciting, something special. Every single moment I have some vivid recollection or image that truly defines this unique piece of work. A delicate love affair, or a scalding emotional journey of adventure?

The Aristocats is really quite charming , and is rated far too low on IMDb . The songs are n't  enough

To recommend the movie. Although it is simple and heart-warming, the combination of Disney music, witty dialogue and endearing characters sets it apart from any ordinary kid's movie. Children find the colorful fur-characters immensely amusing, but the theme of loving one's family should make even a mature viewer take pause and be nostalgic. Though its rating may never rival Snow White's and Beauty's Beast's, this joyful jaunt around the French countryside earns an unmistakable special place in the Disney pantheon.

I was pleasantly surprised by the depth of story and character development. Fulci was a master at creating horrific atmosphere using inventive camera work, vivid cinematography, and yes - wonderfully explicit gore.This film is no exception, however, compared to his later films (The Beyond, Zombie 2, City of the Living Dead, House by the Cemetery, etc.) the characters here are extremely well developed and the emphasis shies away from the supernatural and is more on the suspense created by a classic who-dunnit amongst the lush hills of Italy.

This movie is beautiful in all ways. It is visually stunning, and this is a good thing since the dialogue would only take up a page or two of paper. The acting is superb; it is subtle, passionate and intense. Ben Daniels does a fabulous job of turning himself into an animal, and mixing that wild nature with a man's overbearing passion and honor. There is not one flaw, not one mistake or wrong moment to be found anywhere. It is completely perfect, but only if you understand what you're going to experience.

A great movie. The movie was even better then the commercials put on. And believe it or not it was very very inspirational. I really think anyone who walks out of the movie at the end will be inspired one way or another.It was kinda corny at the very beginning, but quickly picks up. I laughed. I laughed very hard on some parts. The acting is basically above average, nothing special, but better then average. I can safely say it was the second funniest movie to come out this summer (1st funniest being CLERKS II).

This is a stunning movie. Raw and sublimely moving. It felt like a very gripping, intelligent stage play (but without the overly theatrical feeling one actually gets from watching people on a stage) which plays on everyone's terror of a white lie escalating to monstrous consequences. All of the main players are mesmerising. Tom Wilkinson broke my heart at the end... and everyone else's judging by the amount of fumbling for hankies and hands going up to faces among males and females alike. Julian Fellowes has triumphed again. He's a national treasure.

Belonging to the subgenre of post-apocalyptic future films , it is a stylistic and very very intimate installment . The  feel of emptiness created is marvelous

It tackles deep moral quandries that questions viewers ' belief system of idealistic hope and grasps ones instinct for survial at times. Focused around its intangibility, this modern classic engages audiences on many levels which foster engagement in a no-previous-manual era. Adopting distinct color tints, lack of effects to profound subtle facial expressions – these three feature share striking homogeneity that straddles a ubiquitous arc of tension; rise, fall and revolutionized cadence of something further transcendental.

I can not say this movie was a hilarious, but I must have had a grin on my face the entire time. I like this darker kind of comedy; "very bad things", "8 heads in a duffel bag" or "coldblooded"The way the main character tries to get away with murder is a lot of fun to watch. To me it was not much of a surprise what the ending would be, but the way that ending came about was. Another thing that sticks out, is the way they have managed to involve the audience.

I know this movie isn't for everyone, and I won't push my opinions on you, but what I have to say is the truth about how many people feel about this movie...It was the best I have ever seen!!! It was soooooooooooooooooo funny, and even though it wasn't the scariest movie I had ever seen, it kept me on the edge of my seat, because I didn't know what was gonna happen next. If you like funny scary movies, you have got to see this one!

A surprisingly great cartoon in the same league as Batman:TAS and its ilk, I enjoyed it in my youth and recently had been able to watch them all again, great voice acting from Tim Curry, Richard Moll, Tony Jay, and Maurice LaMarche in various roles. The only qualm I had was Rob Paulsons voice seemed a little too old for the title character, but that wasn't a big deal as the stories were great, and the fact that the whole thing has a great time loop twist ending.

When the Romulans come , they will not be bearing gifts ; no , they bring with them war -  machines and tales of bitter losses , dead colonies ,

The Romulans’ advance is menacing, as if an enormous shadow is ever growing closer to blot out the sun. It seems there is no respite from their presence; terror begins to permeate each space, following with the undertone of gathering oppression. Everyone remains worried - were these horrible rumours actually coming true? Then, much to our dismay, the reports of battle finally began coming through, harrowing tales of hardship and atrocities suffered.

This is a well directed Columbo episode, with also some good character but the story just doesn't really know to interest enough and doesn't appear as well layered and constructed as was often the case with a Columbo movie. This also goes for the killer's plot to kill his uncle. It's quite simple and doesn't seem as well thought out. Perhaps this movie didn't really took itself serious enough, since the atmosphere of the movie is mostly light. At least when compared to different Columbo movies.For instance the movie features quite a large amount of comical relief, mostly coming from the Columbo character himself.

* * 1/2 Elisha Cuthbert , Chad Michael Murray , Brian Van Holt , Paris Hilton and Jon Abrahams . Paris Hilton is the poster-child of celebrity notoriety, with countless media headlines recounting her adventures in music, television, and fashion. Elisha Cuthbert stars as Kim Bauer on Fox's drama '24'. Chad Michael Murray continues to shine in movies and TV projects with memorable performances as a leading man in television’s most beloved shows. Brian Van Holt provides one of the series’ major themes in "Sons of Anarchy", where his portrayal as John “Jax” Teller evoked a man seeking a second chance.

So it 's not an award winner , so what ? Have you ever wanted to see a film that  felt like real life ? This movie may not win awards, but it certainly feels more real and relevant than any blockbuster out there. Not only will you experience the typical raw emotion, but it also conveys an unmatchable insight into society and culture that big budget films simply lack. It's all of these aspects and more that really makes it worth the watch. Moreover, you'd likely appreciate that there are rarely any sugar-coating moments and events taking place, just exactly what happened with or without bias.

I 've been a fan of Rachael 's since the beginning of 30MM on the Food Network , so I  was very excited when I learned she was coming out with a line of cookware. I had been eagerly waiting to try the Rachael Ray line and when I finally did I was blown away. I could tell the quality of the pans was unlike any others. The construction was excellent, with ergonomic handles for better gripping, induction stove top compatibility, and excellent heat distribution. Plus, with the diamond-reinforced construction, it was scratch and tarnish-resistant too!

This film as it is now is far shorter than it was when released in 1918 . In fact ,  when it premiered, it was just over four hours long. Its immense running time was because it was so controversial and vast in scale that directors H &L Pik Novice needed time to explore a full narrative across their 40 odd scenes. Each of these scenes tried to explore social expectations, address oppression of those without power and think about the obligations we owe to people within society, considering key arguments for the proponents of peace at a time where society was changing fast and instability threatened in more ways than one.

It 's up there with Where 's Poppa , The Groove Tube , Putney Swope . It memorializes the NY  comedy scene before the advance of punk

Coincidentally it ties in with important subplots involving taboo movements such as Punk and Hip hop, becoming evident even within its narrative. Death to Smoochy further gives testament to the laid back comic movement beginning to morph. Up to then edgy portrayals would often substitute laugh for gruesome disruption that'd piss people off without anyone having a clue it was lightened with metaphor. Death To Smoochy built off from predecessors pushing comedy thresholds testing open thought contexts wrapped around subjects nobody saw coming!

Double Shock is one of the many good Columbo episodes which reaches the level of a good movie.It has all the elements we like in the Columbo episodes. We get the laugh when Columbo makes something clumsy, and it happens more than once in Double Shock. I can almost guarantee that you will laugh several times if you decide to watch this episode.We also get the riddle as usual with an almost perfect murder, but something about the murder troubles Columbo. The end is the usual, we get the story about how Columbo solved the mystery.This is another good Columbo-episode, and I will rate it 7/10.

A very weird, psychedelic, esoteric, (and did I say weird? :) experience.But on at least on one level - it did exactly what it was supposed to do. It bridged the gap between the silly, manufactured, Hollywood look at teen pop idols that was the Monkees TV program and the adult, musically growing and evolving, and yet still a little silly Monkees of the '70s and beyond.The most important line in the film is Mike Nesmith's, "If they think we are plastic now, wait till they see how we do it."

The Monkees, surprisingly, are a big favorite of mine. Yes, they might have been the original manufactured rock band; a gimmick that certainly has reached overkill in the 21st century. However, their music holds up as some of the best the 1960's had to offer. Last Train To Clarksville, Daydream Believer, I'm A Believer, (I'm Not) Your Stepping Stone, Valleri and Pleasant Valley Sunday are great songs, written by good songwriters such as Boyce/Hart, Neil Diamond, Goffen/King and John Stewart.

I first saw The Victim ( aka Out Of Contention ) well over 25 years ago when I was very  young. I still remember how enthralled I was as I watched it; the story drew me in and captivated me as the stakes of the central characters climbed ever higher. Ever since, I have remained a big fan of the movie, feeling very lucky to have witnessed its special qualities, which still stand up after so much time. Watching it never fails to entertain me and many of my friends and family members I have encouraged to see it often comment that they too understand its timeless qualities.

I think I was recommended this film by the lady in the shop I was hiring it from ! For  a long time the cinema was my sole provider for stories but since becoming increasingly difficult and inaccessible due to lockdowns it was nice to have this available

Renting DVDs from the shop felt like a breath of fresh air and opened my world to stories and worlds from long ago that I couldn't explore until then. This DVD rental was only one of a selection available from the store which also recommended some fantastic films and tv series.

I 'm not a massive Disney fan , but my 7 year old son is starting to get into them 

I thought I would buy him the Lion King to start off. I must admit that watching the movie myself was amazing! I forgot how beautiful the animation was and how much detail is in each and every frame. The scenery and visuals were absolutely stunning. We then went and watched a few other classics, like Bambi and The Little Mermaid. Watching them, we both enjoyed reminiscing on those care-free days of our childhood, feeling young and naive once more.

I think that this short TV series, was absolutely wonderful, and gave both a in-depth and clear explanation of everything that was on the screen at the given time. This was by far David Attenborough at his best. I personally thought this was one of the best documentaries in the past decade. This is definitely worth peoples money!I also found the bit about the abyss and deep water the most fascinating and interesting part. It was incredible to find out that the 'Blue planet' team discovered more than 10 new species of underwater life!

I am a guy , so i was very hesitant to watch the movie because i know that Richard Gear  was to do

But despite that, I couldn't resist the temptation to watch it. After watching the movie, I must admit that Richard Gear had done justice to the character. The way he brought the intense moments alive had an extra ordinary effect. He captured the essence of the script, making it true-to-life. I was impressed by his depth of performance, emotional appeal and charisma he gave to his character.

I was surprised and touched by this emotional movie which moved me very strange. I was confused, sad and happy in the same moment. I guess that too less people will pay attention to this movie. But I hope that at least a few will see it and get something out of it. The story of two friends, linked by their suffers of bodily disability, whom (as a team) beat the medical well-fare system and fight for their rights. This movie shows a side which some of us would never understand, not too exaggerated but emotional presented.

This interesting film noir features three very good performances : Sanders , Patrick , and Blackmer . The scenes between  these three actors are some of the best of the movie . Their chemistry comes through clearly, as each character competes for dominance of the plot in unique ways. Sanders is always reserved yet intimidating; Patrick acts strong, hiding her inner turmoil beneath a composed face; and Blackmer manages to draw on hidden reservoirs of anger and remorse at a moments notice. Overall, the trios dynamics never fail to provide an engaging plot which has the audience at the edge of their seat.

SHOWTIME is a mess , but it 's an entertaining mess . The plot is forgettable , the satire is  bizarre , but the visuals are beautiful. Despite the script 's cliché moments, it presents some intriguing themes that cleverly incorporate both light-hearted humor and horror . What really makes it great are its magnificent, distinct colors and elaborate production design. Even though the cinematography often cuts corners with shots and montage that too-explicitly spell out what we 're seeing, its patchwork is held together by luscious hues, juxtaposed imagery and comical expressions. SHOWTIME elevates its somewhat overused concepts with its artistic identity, creating a viewing experience like no other.

This movie shows that the free enterprise system and the quest for the almighty buck transcends all racial and ethnic barriers. Ultimately the market place determines the message that is sent to the public. This movie dramatizes that point. A conservative white-collar advertising company is taken over by a group of street-wise African Americans chaired by a no-nonsense black man who wants to make a buck and believes he can sell products by telling the the truth. But the movie shows that no matter how hard he tries to do something different, the market place and the political system demands that he conform, rendering him no different than his predecessors.

This is by far one of the best movies I have seen in a very long time . Top 20  of all-time for me for sure. The movie gave me feelings and emotions that I never expected to experience when watching. It was engaging and thrilling at every second, and kept me glued to my seat for its entirety. The overall plot and characters were interesting, the ending felt satisfying and the soundtrack and visuals were fantastic. Watching this movie has easily become my favourite past time and I'd urge everyone to check it out - it truly is a great example of cinema.

I love this movie a lot. I must get this on DVD. I have 2 VHS copies, but the quality is so poor that you can't read one written joke over the door of the ward. I'm forever amazed that Blankfield did almost nothing afterward. He made both Dr. Jeckle and Mr. Hyde totally believable.The movie is plagued by it's low budget. (One atrocious edit jumps into mid-word and was described on, "Siskel & Ebert".) But, there are a thousand jokes, sight gags to subtle references, that more than compensate.

I wish there were more films about middle aged people . The intellectual journey and the twists and turns of  the adventures middle aged people endure tend to get overlooked. Many of us are reinventing ourselves as the children leave home and we enter this often joy-filled, new stage of our lives. However, much of our enthusiasm can sometimes fade when the enthusiasm of youth slowly fails to recognise our work as true art or doesn't realise the vulnerability, creativity and level of wisdom we possess. We deserve the celebration and awe experienced by generations after us who romanticise our lifestyle and adventure.

Jack, Sawyer and Sayid swim to the boat and find a completely wasted Desmond. His traumatic past experience before sailing to the island is disclosed through flashbacks. Sayid plots a plan with Jack to surprise "The Others" in case Michael is double-crossing the group. John Locke convinces Desmond to invade the hatch, which is protected by Mr. Eko, and not press the button of the computer to see what will happen.This episode is one of the best of the Second Season. Unfortunately, we lovers of "Lost" can see the lack of respect the producers of this stunning series have with the fans.

I was 19 or 20 , years old at the time and living in Salt Lake City , Utah and  attending college. I was still in the early stages of adjusting to this change and life. One summer day, I remember my first free day feeling overwhelming - like I had more choices than I could handle and they all needed to be perfect. Despite being over excited to not have any set plans, I wanted them all to work out. I wasn't sure where to start, so I decided to spend the morning with my laptop creating my own bucket list.

Another enjoyable Warner flick . I really liked John Garfield in this , though I 'm wondering why Cagney was  never part of the gang . I'm also wondering how different it would've been with Cagney's charisma and edgy on screen presence - no one ever exudes cool better. Nevertheless, the main leads steal the show. With Spencer Tracy delivering his always cool style and timing, you get a genuine pleasure out of the way he toys with character weaknesses to amuse and inflame their antagonism and sense of abandonment. On top of that, Raoul Walsh has great lines for comedic banter and commentaries.

Just exactly HOW director John Madden come to settle with Nicolas Cage and Penelope Cruz playing the roles of an Italian Officer and a Greek Villager in an honourable story: "Captain Correli´s Mandolin", just escapes me! Witness: a wobbly, inconsistent accent by Cage amid horrendous over-acting, with Cruz -- more adequately cast as a spoiled Latino opposite Johnny Depp in "Blow" -- in basically a repeat performance under the guise of a Greek nurse... ay, it was painful. But there were saving graces.The story itself is thrilling-to-tragic, and Cage does have some (-- redeeming, this is !--) musical ability.

I didn't know what to expect when I rented this widescreen DVD. I knew it had a cult following but I had also seen a lot of the director's later works which although delightfully gory were also pretty much incoherent. DON'T TORTURE A DUCKLING actually had a linear storyline and a mystery that kept me guessing almost until the end. And after all was said and done, it was a genuinely unsettling and creepy experience. One major caveat: I would much rather have heard the original soundtrack and read English subtitles than the uneven dubbing found here.

Easily Lucio Fulci's most respected film, "Don't Torture a Duckling" is highly renowned for it's edgy subject matter, gruesome imagery, and strong storyline. Terror befalls a small Italian village as young boys begin turning up murdered, engulfing the confused and determined authorities plus a dedicated detective in mystery. Was it the creepy hermit? The spastic voodoo witch? One of the hookers? The rich girl? Someone else? Contrary to most fan's frequent representation on the film's violent content - I consider it much more plot driven; featuring only one real moment of memorable bloodshed (involving chains and boards).

I absolutely love this film and have seen it many times . I taped it in about 1987 when it  first aired

Over the years I've probably seen it over twenty times now and every single time, it just gives me such a wonderful feeling. It speaks so closely to my heart that every time I'm watching it, it gives me such nostalgia and heart-warming feeling like I've been brought back in time. I definitely rate this one 5 stars because of how incredibly thought-provoking the film was, it makes me connect emotionally on so many levels with the characters and events throughout the film.

This is a wonderful movie, and I still love it! It just so magical and it is fun for the whole family! I recommend it to people of all ages. I promise you will not be disappointed! The characters are always so engaging, so real, you will just love them! The story of Gerda and Kai falling in love will really amaze you and put that little spark of magic into your life.I don't see how anyone would care if the movie matched the book, I mean the movie was amazing! I haven't even read the book, and guess what?

Between sweeping , extraordinary scenes within a plethora of Indian locations and a plot which is Bollywood inspired yet grounded  in true crime. The powerful actors cast in lead roles bring even further life to an emotive and unexpected narrative, set over three unique eras of India's post independence story. Period sequences a wealth of accomplished supporting talent all adding to a special and meaningful ride. There is never a dull moment - indeed each dynamic chapter unlocks questions to which no-one can accurately anticipate the answers. Equally stirring soundtrack that knits the story together exquisitely makes it all the more moving.

I think that anybody whose dumb enough to risk being a wax dummy just so they can go to a football game or they don't want to leave their car "to get stripped" deserves whatever happens to them.The guy, Wade who "went to a barbershop and asked for the He-Man haircut" wasn't my type, but there's this really cute scene of him having his eyebrows and facial hair waxed. That's a little too high-maintenance for me. Also fun, but not my type is the fat guy in the big sunglasses who looks "like Elton John only gayer," but that whole plot goes nowhere!

This little film is hysterical, full of stereotypes about gays, straights, dwarfs, British tea and pubs, American gun culture, divorce and marriage; yet, it manages to be sensitive to the issues surrounding each. Kathy Bates is "Amazing" Grace Beasley, and as a character actor of staggering range, she brings her considerable comedic talent to ground this somewhat unusual film as she did in Fried Green Tomatos. With the help of other comedic talents like Dan Akroid as Max, her ex-lawyer husband and the backdrop of downtown Chicago and rural England, the story is just intriguing enough to entertain.

Yes , at times `` Unconditional Love '' overwhelms as it bounces -- no , as it ricochets -- from  heart to heart! Our expectations expand as it radiates, affects, engulfs and shields our senses, bringing life joy and charm. Every relationship enhanced , stability is extended, principles become integral and indispensable even to generations that carry the immutable emotions further. Every whisper creates an equal-like exclamation, admiration shared runs zillions like infinity into directions together or divide. Every drop shines fiercely vibrant each time emerging beyond commonness growing resilient bequeathing love through centuries with magic reciprocating growing spell.

I have to admit that I approached this movie with a sense of expectation and dread . Louis de Berniere 's books have consistently won awards for their clarity of expression and originality, and I was hoping for something similar from the film version. Fortunately, my expectation was rewarded. From the clever scripting, inventive sets and passionate direction, this film soared to the heights that I had wanted and then exceeded it. I was literally mesmerized from beginning to end, thrilled to have encountered characters that captivated my imagination. Each cast member embraced the beauty of the written characters in the film.

Lucio Fulci, later known for his graphic horror films like The Beyond and Zombie, was years earlier a master of the Italian giallo (in the company of Argento and Bava) with films like A Lizard In A Woman's Skin and his masterpiece, Don't Torture A Duckling. This film has all the elements of the Italian mystery/thriller genre known as the giallo, but really pulls the viewers in by having each key character with a skeleton in his/her own closet. This keeps you doing as much detective work as the detectives in the film itself. Who is killing the young boys in town?

When I saw this film at a festival years ago I was very impressed and I started to looking for it. Nothing to do, not in the cinemas, nor on DVD neither on Blue ray. Absolutely nothing!!! How it's possible this could really happen??? The direction is IMPECCABLE, the story is intriguing and has been filmed in a very original way the music it's perfect and James Franco is hot as hell!! !Please release this master piece and allow it to have it's proper life!!!!!!!!!!

They Made Me a Criminal is a remake of an earlier Warner Brothers film , The Life of Jimmy Dolan 

They Made Me a Criminal focuses on an boxer turned gang member by the name of Johnny Brady. It follows his transformation from a life of hard fought victory to the tough streets of LA, with his morals seemingly sinking with each scrap and knife fight. The moral grey-area John operates in, fighting both ‘law enforcement’ and his gang, throws up question marks over both groups with results he hopes to improve, albeit no positive certainty can be guaranteed.

I just thought I would add another observation , here . While there are a couple of visual sub-references ,  like someone practicing telekinesis or shots of crystals in different frames, these didn't detract much from the original intent. What I did observe, however, was a repeated reference to strings and continuity - at both levels. I think this represents a point to grasp when building new abstract visuals - don't rush to introduce a ton of other ideas, but allow yourself some simple steps and backtrack from the first thing to something tangible.

Yes, at times "Unconditional Love" overwhelms as it bounces -- no, as it ricochets -- from one story element to another in the most unconventional use of thematic elements and characters. In fact, it wasn't until I watched the film for the second time that I began to understand what I think P.J. Hogan might have been attempting to do with this quirky, unconventional flick. Perhaps the entire film itself is a metaphor for the unconditional love for which Grace (Kathy Bates) yearns and describes in the later part of the film.

When I saw this movie i expected it to be a cheesy American movie done on the cheap with appalling  dialogue. However I was pleasantly surprised when the movie turned out to be engaging and deep in its storyline. The acting was well done and the cast fit into their respective characters very well. The script was surprisingly nuanced, and each character developed over time. There were humorous and emotional moments that came naturally rather than feeling forced and superficial. As the film developed, so too did my appreciation and admiration for the direction, pacing and style.

This film biography of early rock and roll star Buddy Holly ( 1936-1959 ) is a tour de force for  Gary Busey, the actor who plays Holly. Busey encapsulates both the persona and musical styles of Holly in a gripping performance of style and power. He wins over a reluctant Father figure and risks much for a timeless Rock and Roll tour that never got to begin, playing venue across America with Elvis and more icons of their times. Buddy died too young at just 22, his dream undone and those who got to know him losing someone really special.

The Snowqueen is one of the best love stories I have ever seen : much better and deeper than Luhrman 's "Romeo and Juliet". It gives an unforgettable experience while showcasing some valuable lessons that viewers can take from the story, from learning to trust your heart in spite of hard times, to cherishing family and love when you have it. Additionally, The Snowqueen depicts romantic relationships not only with honesty but with complexity. Although its bittersweet end will bring tears to your eyes, it still sends out an extremely powerful message of compassion and everlasting friendship.

A beautifully photographed and paced short film . It evocatively captures the feeling of this family and much of the  lingering angst that can surface in uncomfortable familial settings

The family bickers over trivial issues and there is a lot of subtext underlying the conversational encounters. The conversations circle but never move forward, leaving some conclusions tacit. But each one knows their place and the world order inside their apartment block. There are poignant moments of tears and an inexplicable something hanging between them. There's a claustrophobic atmosphere building throughout and suddenly they come to a stillness; allowing an almost unexplainable feeling in.

This version of `` The Lost Horizon '' is actually not a bad film at all . I think the  characters are surprisingly well portrayed , especially for the limited technology of the time . It was much improved upon with recent remakes which adds updated visual effects and storylines that stay closer to the original novel . Yet the iconic moments remain. Robert Conway trying to fix the broken airplane, the elderly monk stumbling upon their crash, or even the dazzling paradise of Shangri-la all stir an unforgettable spirit and thrill that could only be born in 1933.

This is without a doubt the most stunning and amazing documentary I have ever seen ! The images that are  portrayed in this film really tell a story in and of themselves. The sheer beauty of what is on display makes it almost as if we have entered into a whole different world and witnessing its wonders in action. The scenes created and expertly composed with much attention to detail give us insight and great joy as if to share a journey through the souls of some remarkable people, through and over the decades that these stunning visuals lay.

Really , This movie should be released to DVD . I just got a bootleg copy of what I think  might be the pre-released version and can’t wait to watch it. I plan to make this a movie night with all of my friends so I can properly take advantage of having the rare pre-release copy. We're going to need plenty of snacks to power through it and will stock up on lots of candy, chips, popcorn and maybe a few energy drinks for the times it gets too late for the sleepyheads.

Like some people here , I love/loved Stingers ! In Norway it got aired a lot later . That also  had it's positives though; With more people around me I finally got to talk and gossip about the TV show I was passionate about

I felt excited each time a new episode was released, as this meant I finally got to experience the twist and turns with my peers and family. All the buzzing in our neighbourhood made the experience even more thrilling. It took some adjusting to since all of us were already tuned to another TV series. Eventually everyone fell in love with Stingers.

I 've read a lot of reviews about Showtime on IMDb and many seem to miss the mark . I 

The critical reactions seem to contradict themselves as many also make mention of Showtime’s impact on them in positive ways, including taking audiences on an unexpected and much appreciated journey of self-discovery and understanding. Through incredible casting, quality music selection and of course timely storytelling, Showtime immerses viewers in the struggles and lives of characters many had otherwise felt alien to. This appreciation translates to messages viewers must face regardless of their personal preferences and inspirations.

I really enjoyed this film , it definitely keeps you on the edge of your seat . It was very  exciting to follow the protagonist and his journey in a very compelling manner. The protagonists were well portrayed and were able to convey complex emotions very naturally and effortlessly. This is a rare feat, particularly when trying to translate the turmoil from being from a very troubled individual's view point. Watching how the different characters interact with one another as the tension slowly increased created an engaging atmosphere for the audience. While the cinematography wasn't very adventurous, there were still unique compositions that helped compliment certain emotional parts of the narrative.

Forget Easy Rider - Head is THE film about the 1960s.Almost laugh : as the Monkees reduce their entire career  to 8-bit sound bites! Written and directed by Bob Rafelson, Head helped popularize music videos, fusing seemingly absurd snippets of iconic stars - Bob Dylan, Sonny Liston and others - in an ongoing episodic collage. Reflecting the era’s experimental attitude and vibrancy, the film sits alongside classic songs of The Beatles and Rascals that, some how, coexist with Sal Mineo promoting nudist colonies! Nothing made perfect sense; just like the era.

To say the truth , I went to see this movie only because Nicolas Cage is my favorite actor . I have always had great respect and admiration for his work, and so I decided to check out this particular movie even though the reviews were not that great. Even though the storyline had its flaws, the acting performance from Nicolas Cage was absolutely breathtaking. He had a great chemistry with other characters and knew how to create a magical, intense and amazing atmosphere with his emotions. Overall, it was a memorable experience for me and I definitely plan to go to the theatre for Nicolas Cage's upcoming projects.

The big names in film tried to do their part for the war effort, and Charlie Chaplin was no exception. This patriotic and propagandist picture is part of his contribution, although the war was nearly over by the time of its release. The tramp goes to war, humorously accomplishes acts of heroism and kicks the Kaiser in the bum. It's a very funny film, although I don't think it nearly one of his best. It's with 'A Dog's Life' as his better output for First National before he made his early masterpiece 'The Kid.'

I think this show was right on the money for me. I watched it over the plane but there were parts in the movie that made me control myself from tearing all over the place. The chemistry between Richard gere and Diane lane was very believable (fantastic acting on both parts)! I loved how Diane lane's daughter acted in the show too. She displayed maturity and how she transformed throughout the show was easy to believe as what a teenager could possibly be like in real life. I loved this show from start to end. Definitely recommended for the romantic people out there!

This movie got better with time. I can't believe that it has been forty years since I saw this at the age of 15. Yes, that's right. Movie ratings were not yet a reality, so any teenager could walk into any movie. Imagine what it was like for a kid my age to see both Midnight Cowboy and Putney Swope in the same year. Imagine the times. Bobby Kennedy and Martin Luther King has just been killed but the following summer had a man walking on the moon and Woodstock. Putney Swope was the Woodstock nation's chance to stick it to the man.

Most critics seem to have dismissed this film , like so many other Charles Bronson vehicles , as just another  violent , eye-candy filled bit of escapist entertainment . Others are not as so readily dismissed, pointing out the richness and detail of Bronson's often very tightly defined roles and even the nuances of his physical presence onscreen. Many attribute this talent to Bronson's association with well known action director John Sturges as both frequently team together for collaborative efforts on more complex , grittier works . These roles arguably prepared Bronson for for more substantial leading character turns later in his career .

Motorama viewers should already by keen on other offbeat b-grade desert-based films such as Bagdad Cafe or Repo Man (which more or less takes place in the desert). It also models some of the bizarre humor (and especially eccentric trail of characters) of writer Joseph Minion's comedy, 'After Hours.' In a sort of desert roadtrip fantasy, a metaphor of temptation and redemption, Gus (played well by Jordan Christopher Michael), a clever 10 year-old boy cashes in his piggy bank, steals a Mustang, and runs away from his grossly neglecting parents.

I just had the opportunity to see 'Nuovomondo ' ( hitherto known in the U.S. as 'The Golden Door ' ). The film was deeply touching and had an incredible, soul-searching effect. The story line revolved around a young southern Italian peasant family immigrating to the U.S. during the early 20th Century. Even though we are several decades removed from the era portrayed, I was deeply moved and sympathetic with the families difficulties in making it in a strange new world. They took courageous, momentous risks to achieve a dream - the American dream.

Chucky's back...and it's about time! This time, with the help of Jennifer Tilly and a little spell from Voodoo For Dummies. Well, at least with this installment, the camp is back. This was the more gruesome of this series, so far. It has some good twists and some good action scenes. This one was by far, the most fun of the series, and successfully, if unintentionally, bridges the gap between pure horror to horror/comedy. I am looking forward to Seed of Chucky. It'll be a hoot!

This is a 100% improvement over the dross of a third movie and it's one hell of a good time. This is a John Hughes movie meets The Devil's Rejects. I really enjoyed this movie and it really stands out as the savior of the series. I thought Jennifer Tilly played Tiffany really well and Brad Dourif in Chucky's shoes once again really makes this movie shine. Actually they're the only good parts of the movie. I got rather bored with Katherine Heigl and Nick Stable's scenes. It's as if they were thrown in there as a sidetrack and someone to save the day.

I just ca n't understand why people are surprised this movie makes no sense . It was never supposed to ! It's written by a team of comedic writers and satirizes society as we know it. It mocks politicians, celebrities, news and entertainment outlets, and the internet - a particularly amusing set of objects if one steps back and considers it. Of course the movie won't make sense if you think it's meant to tell a traditional story, but that's beside the point. People should be embracing the farcical yet essential lessons it offers instead of making useless criticisms!

I always liked this movie , I have seen it so many times but I always enjoyed it : ) 

The comedy is incredibly funny and all the characters are so lovable. Every time I watch this movie I end up laughing non-stop. The ending always brings tears to my eyes as it highlights how all of the main characters found family, happiness and love through difficult times. This movie reminds me how important it is to be positive, work together and cherish each day like it was your last. Seeing it so many times helps me reflect, let go and open my eyes to my reality.

The `` all I have is 5 dollars and my wedding ring ... '' scene was a riot . I  couldn't help but chuckle every time. It seemed like everyone was making the same joke about not being able to do much with just five dollars and a wedding ring. The reactions of the people around me ranged from understanding smiles to uproarious laughter. While the line itself is humorous, the facial expressions and reactions it received only heightened the funny mood. Of course, this might not have the same effect without the warmth of an audience.

Who could have thought a non-disabled actor could act so realistically and immensely powerfully as a disabled person in a film? Probably someone. But no-one, truly no-one, could ever compare their expectations with the amazingly emotive and powerful performance given by the two actors in this film.Michael (Steven Robertson) lives in a home for disabled people. He has Cerebral Paulsy, and as shown to us right at the beginning, he has huge trouble communicating. So it truly is a lifeline when fellow disabled member Rory (James McAvoy) who can speak normally, understands him.

The movie does n't take itself seriously , and if you follow its lead you 're going to have a  great time. It isn't exactly a game changer, but it certainly achieves the goals that it sets out. There is plenty of action, but also plenty of humor too, even a romantic moment between the two protagonists that doesn't quite feel forced. If you want something easy to watch but not an easy ride then you're sure to enjoy the movie. It isn't one to over think either - its simplicity actually leaves more room to enjoy what's actually on offer here.

This searing drama based on a true incident concerns several ambitious African nationals who decide to temporarily leave their families  to go in search of greater opportunities abroad. When they embark on the treacherous and sometimes ill-fated mission of traversing across vast and unfamiliar borders in pursuit of the allure of European promises, their risk is slowly revealed. Not all are able to sustain the tiresome road and huge costs associated with navigating complex immigration policies; not all manage to break down the looming bureaucratic, ethnic and racial barricades encountered by ambitious African asylum seekers and migrants on a quest for a better life abroad.

Like some people here, I love/loved Stingers! In Norway it got aired a lot later. That also means that we are in the 176th episode. (yea, that's right) I have to say that I really love Stingers! It can make me cry, laugh, smile and so on. I think I'm going to die the day we reach episode number 192. Stingers might be the on series(except from Grey's Anatomy) that I really watch! The actors are amazing! Especially Jacinta Stapleton! Personallly I think she is one of the best access we have!

No. I'm not kidding with this one. He was a guest reviewer for Entertainment Weekly and gave this movie positive marks. And who can blame him? This is a charming, upbeat, and rather funny Disney movie. Who doesn't love kittens? The music in Ev'rybody Wants To Be A Cat is jamming. It makes me want to snap my fingers or something. Only years later when Cats Don't Dance came out have I seen a movie that was that musically fun. What Aristocats lacks in animation and story, it makes up for in charm.

Although this film never attained commercial notoriety , my experience has led me to conclude that many well-done pieces of  cinematographic art fly just below the radar of recognition. I had heard of several indie movies getting such love that got converted into full feature films, with wide releases and much commercial success. Such moves revealed to me the creativity which drives even seemingly unknown work which hold substance and further need support in order to gain public adulation. Small artists or no name production houses will thus remain driven to try and succeed by uncovering original gems of storytelling that remains unseen until audiences discover it.

The Snowqueen is one of the best love stories I have ever seen: much better and deeper than Luhrman's Romeo&Juliet or Spielberg's Titanic. Gerda's love impresses me every time, her search, her battle is exceptional. Gerda becomes a strong, loving woman throughout the movie. Kay is the poisoner of dark forces: the temptation. This story encourages me to fight like Gerda for the ONLY ONE, for the love of my life, for Mister Right. Patience is one of the keywords of this movie. I cry every time when I realize all the suffering of Gerda and Kay.

Then again, I like Rachael Ray. She is fun, sweet, fresh, and such a joy to watch. I have to alter just about everything she makes as I am a vegetarian...but it's great to see her with a program that shows more of her personality. After all, she is a television personality. I think it's cool that she is so inviting with her fans and still appears to be down-to-earth. The studio audience appears to be rather small, but that just makes for a cozier environment. Some people have posted that the show sucks.

Head should have been a proud moment not just for its stars ( The Monkees and Victor Mature ) ,  but for everybody 

Unfortunately, Head is generally misunderstood and was declared a failure after its debut. Critical recognition was not widespread at the time but subsequent re-releases gave the movie some attention and esteem. Despite mixed reviews, a variety of talent has become evident since Head was made and while there might not have been instant success it set the stage for ground breaking works of film which spawned other daring works, at times cited as being inspirational by filmmakers in the business.

`` Showtime '' is a funny film starring funnymen Robert DeNiro ( Meet the Parents , A Bronx Tale )  and Eddie Murphy ( Coming to America ). It's an amazing ride as the two switch roles to pursue an unexpected goal - and must outwit an IRS agent as they're pursued through Italy and across Europe! A thrilling cat-and-mouse adventure takes these two mismatched comrades all the way from Paris to Barcelona - with great action, and outrageous fun all along the way! Expect hilarious banter as they laugh, race and occasionally get into scraps, and fight to finish what they started and succeed with their far-fetched scheme.

First off , I absolutely loved this movie . As a Billy Crystal fan , I must say that I  felt extremely emotional 

The script of the movie is so amazing with lines filled with honesty and humor. At the same time, you'll find yourself emotional as it captures life lessons as it unveils its hidden treasures in every scene. What more, the execution and transitions are fluid enough to even keep kids intrigued by the film. Even the finale of the film left me in a state of awe that words could not even begin to describe.

This movie possesses something most other movies of its genre do not: intelligence and good messages. Accepted, is the story of a kid named Bartleby (Justin Long) who gets rejected by every college he applies to. His parents are incredibly strict, frustrated and disappointed. So, Bartleby and a few other students who face similar problems start a fake college, to pawn themselves off to their parents as college kids. Not everything goes to plan, and the movie is about them winging it. But behind this plot which sounds ridiculous, there are good messages, morals and a new outlook on the American educational system.

Better than it has any right to be , this movie died a quick and painful death at the American  box office but is now recognized as an example of unconventional independent cinema at its finest. Fortunately, despite its box-office struggles, it has since become widely-recognized as a cult classic. Critical reception of the movie has remained highly positive since its release and, in the present day, is almost universally hailed as an underground masterpiece. The creative minds behind it even enjoyed a retrospective career surge in later years, mainly driven by the fan’s glowing recognition of their impressive original vision.

These critics need to find a new job!!! This movie is based on a TRUE STORY, which has made history. It illustrates beautifully how even in the mist of war and tragedy love can conquer all. The breathtaking Chephallonia of Greece has captured my heart and soul as if I too were there. The Blue eyed Cage & the delightful Cruz were amazing! Together they perfectly portrayed how a Mediterranean couple can only become closer in the time of war. This movie will touch your heart like it did mine you must go see it!!! !

"Head" is a film that has held up well since its original release date in 1968. The movie is a complete contradiction of the Monkees image. It presents the Monkees in a way their fans never perceived them; men with real thoughts. Totally controlled by their producers, the Monkees were given the opportunity to tell their side of the story. The film pokes fun at their image, the entertainment industry, and corporate America. The soundtrack contains some of their best music. It's a movie well worth seeing over and over again.

TV churns out dozens of true-crime movies every year . You can see 3 or 4 every Saturday on Lifetime , especially during the "Bloody June" holiday special. It seems that nowadays true-crime has taken over the TV network’s primetime lineup, making crime drama movies mainstream, an adrenaline rush of shocking reveals and moral dilemmas. Despite some bad takes on real life, actual criminal cases and overwhelming sensitive information – it has pushed people to educate themselves more on our society’s criminal justice and, through it, call out a world with higher injustice and crime rates than ever.

Truly unique and stunning film of Jules Verne's "For The Flag" by the Czech master director Karel Zeman.Although the story is enacted in a rather understated late Victorian style, the visuals are a knockout. Zeman uses animation, graphics, painted sets, model animation combined with live action to create the atmosphere of Verne that the reader associates in his mind. The style resembles the steel engravings of Dore and Bennet and Riou that illustrated these stories with a healthy dose of Georges Melies added.Photographed in beautiful black and white the animation is of the highest order and not of a Saturday morning variety.

The success of SCREAM gave birth to a whole new horror flicks wave . I 'm happy with that ,  but in my view most of these new releases lacks something . Many of these movies aren't unique in the way they've presented the elements of the genre, oftentimes lacking the originality or dynamism that SCREAM provided. It feels as though we, as audiences, are consuming much of the same concepts with a handful of gimmicks every year, leading to a sense of stagnation for the genre as a whole. Not to mention the significant decrease in fear and horror each entry leaves.

My favorite show of all time ! Yeah , I thought this was so cool , and Larisa Oleynik was  definitely my idol 

I would watch it almost everyday and record the new episodes so I didn't miss an episode. I really liked the way Larisa brought a balance between work, education, family and personal life. I used to get inspired from her confident and independent attitude and characters of different age in the series. Each episode presented different situations which made you look at life differently. I realized how we can experience several circumstances without any knowledge about it beforehand.

Head should have been a proud moment not just for its stars (The Monkees and Victor Mature), or its director/co-writer (Bob Rafelson), but also its other co-writer (and brief cameo) Jack Nicholson. As it stands, most of them seem to shun it, and to outsiders the movie is regarded, at best, as a curio.While the T.V. series was famously based on the antics of the Beatles' 'Help! ', this film is also judged by the same accord. Yet far from the trite and painfully overrated Beatles films, and even the dated Monkees T.V.

A nice and pleasant movie full of meditteranean sceneries ( Cephallonia is a very beautiful greek island ) that keeps  all kind of unique secrets hidden throughout the story. It tells a sweet yet haunting tale that doesn't fail to stay true to the idea of simple happiness even under tragic circumstances. Life in the island flows as smoothly and serenely as the wavy coastline. Despite facing war and hardship, people don't lose hope and make peace their destiny. In conclusion, this heartwarming story offers a variety of well-depicted mediterranean characters and brings forth its beauty with enticing dialogues and lively details of the picturesque environment.

I'm not sure why this film is averaging so low on IMDb when it's absolutely everything you could ever want in a horror film. This is the definition of being a horror film. I consider myself to be a big horror fan and I must say that this house delivers the goods. House of wax Is the story of a group of college kids on their way to a football game whom decide to camp out for the night and have a run in with a local weirdo. Upon waking the next morning they make a gruesome discovery and decide to go into town for a broken car part.

Most critics seem to have dismissed this film, like so many other Charles Bronson vehicles, as just another patchwork of mindless violence. And while there is a fair amount of mayhem, DEATH WISH 3 is not that awful of an effort, particularly for fans of the series and its star.This time out, aging Charlie's Paul Kersey is let loose by a police chief desperate to clean up a rough part of New York City. The trigger-happy vigilante moves into the heart of gang territory, where he once again becomes a one-man army in an urban war of good versus evil.

LOL.The mere fact that I start off my review with 'lol ' says it all . I used to watch  movies just for the fun and pass the time with friends .However, lately I've begun to view films from a more critical point of view.I usually watch a movie before I give a review, otherwise my opinions could be influenced by word of mouth. Plus, by taking in every subtle detail I'm able to make well-informed decisions about which movie to recommend and which one not to. Sometimes I watch a movie with some popcorn, so I can get lost in the story.

I think that anybody whose dumb enough to risk being a wax dummy just so they can go to a  concert deserves what they get. Sometimes things don’t go as planned and someone in that situation may experience public humiliation and worse, even being charged with criminal offenses. Being dumb can have serious consequences! But more importantly, being dishonest and trying to deceive security personnel doesn’t help matters. What happened should serve as a reminder to would-be dummy-goers that you should never risk being fake - always follow the proper processes for obtaining access. Taking shortcuts never pay off!

Ross Hunter 's musical remake of the 1937 fantasy , based on James Hilton 's enduring bestseller , was written  by Grace Holdon and Alfred Drake and starred Anne Francis , Burgess Meredith and Martin Benson

It proved to be Ross Hunter's most financially successful motion picture of the 1950's and featured glamorous production design, brilliant performances and renowned costume design. It won two Golden Globe nominations including best picture in color as well as score by Leigh Harline and Lynn Ryle who provided the score. Upon its release, the remake was hailed for its unforgettable visuals, tender soundtrack and extraordinary performances from its talented cast, catapulting it to enormous success.

"Showtime" is a funny film starring funnymen Robert DeNiro (Meet the Parents,A Bronx Tale) and Eddie Murphy (Shrek, Dr. Dolittle). The story is this: In the beginning of the movie detective Mitch (Robert DeNiro) and another detective go into a tv store trying to bust some criminals. When the cops arrive, Tray(Eddie Murphy)a cop, tries to arrest Mitch not knowing he's a cop. During this scene loads of funny things happen which catch the eye of tv producer Chase Ritz.

It 's just that . Chucky 1 was good . Chucky 2 was better . Chucky 3 sucked . Now  Chucky 4 is in the process of getting ready

Chucky 4 is being much talked about, creating waves across the horror movie fans around the world. Chucky has come a long way, over 30 years of evolution and for those who missed it all, the basics go like this. From when it started back in 1988 to the highly successful movie from 2019, it is looking more certain now that this time we'll get to meet the little "Buddi" again and finally put this legend to a full circle.

OK so Paris Hilton sucks in it ( typical Malibu Barbie ) but the rest of the actors are just  fantastic . To make up for Paris, there is also Lindsey Lohan who has been so bubbly, outspoken and exuberant about the whole process. Other actors like Jen Aniston, Dax Shepherd and Ryan Reynolds all lend a hand with the success of the show. Of course, the genius director had done such a brilliant job capturing each personality, creating a lot of organic dialogue which flows wonderfully from one scene to another. We cannot overlook how powerful each actor's emotion could be.

I watched this movie out of a lack of anything else on at the time . Quickly the movie grabbed  my interest and I ended up watching it right to the end. I wasn't sure what to expect but as I continued to watch, I became completely hooked by the story-line. I was engaged by every turn, some parts making me jump from the sheer excitement! I absolutely enjoyed every moment of this great film. Before I knew it, the movie had finished and it was far more enjoyable than I'd imagined it would be.

Another great Tom Wilkinson performance punctuates `` Separate Lies , '' a 2005 film also starring Emily Watson , Linda  Bassett and Rupert Everett . The performances from each character combined masterfully, depicting the guilt and disbelief that emerge as dark secrets and lies surface.The film follows a married couple in a cheating scandal who, overwhelmed by secrecy and misinformation, quickly start spiraling out of control, the tectonic effects eventually cracking their tightly bound social world. Directed by first-time filmmaker Julian Fellowes , Separate Lies quickly moved beyond the cheating cliché in its exceptional performance, sweeping dialogue and layered script, becoming a hit among audiences everywhere.

No . I 'm not kidding with this one . He was a guest reviewer for Entertainment Weekly and gave  movies with unfavorable ratings . He was notorious for speaking his opinion on movies regardless of what others thought. His reviews of horror movies, especially, weren't too favorable as he criticized and highlighted the major flaws of these films. But despite this, he didn't hold back his praise for excellent performances, even for a sub-par movie. His brash comments gave a humorous angle to many moviegoers and their debates online about a specific movie review.

The thing with Ali G is that he takes the mick out of himself and his character. The humour is very much a 'like it or love it' brand of totally politically incorrect, irreverent and self effacing type.Personally I totally love this film, and so has everyone i have met who has seen it. You can watch it several times and pick new gags up each time. The humour is both aural and visual, and the timing is impeccable. The humour is probably very English, and specifically London, so its possible that non-English viewers may not get some of the humour.

I saw this movie on late night TV out of Buffalo about 30 years ago and I 'm dying to  know the title. Unfortunately, trying to track it down hasn't been easy. I think it starred a vampire-like being and something about the five phases of the moon. Every time I saw it I was riveted and have always been haunted by the memory of it. I've looked all over for this film but I'm still not sure who starred in it, who the director was, or even what decade it was released.

LOL.The mere fact that I start off my review with 'lol' says it all. I used to watch this movie all the time as a kid; and even then I sensed the silliness of it all. The low budget, horrible acting and lame script was ever apparent back then. I watched it again yesterday and just couldn't stop laughing. It's so bad it's actually good lol. Like another reviewer said, it doesn't take itself seriously. There's no way one could look at this movie and say that the makers did so.

Hey look , you do n't watch this movie to change your life ! But if you are female especially  if you're around my age - early twenties. You may find bits and pieces in there that might speak to you and give you guidance. It really hits home, specifically when it comes to balancing self-actualization and obligation, staying true to oneself while being in-tune to others, finding confidence without demanding to have your voice heard. Most importantly, it emphasises that learning lessons don’t come solely through having revelations but rather in giving your time and dedication.

That this film flopped at the box office , and still struggles for the recognition it deserves today , is  baffling. But to put that disappointment aside, let us take some time to look deeper into what the movie has to offer.
